Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, cross-nimbed, with right hand raised in blessing, stands above Lazarus, partly shrouded in open grave, his torso supported by man, holding the shroud, partly kneeling at right. At left, Mary and Martha, both of Bethany, nimbed, one wearing headdress, with right hand raised, the other, veiled, with hand raised to face, stand in front of two men, wearing headgears, one holding right hand to nose. At right, two nimbed apostles, one possibly Evangelist John, holding book in left hand and with right hand indicating the Lazarus. Scene in landscape with buildings in distance. Margins with floreate baguette frame decorated with foliate and floreate ornament, including grapes and currants. Margins of facing text page (fol. 100r) decorated with foliate and floreate ornament, including daisies and bird, and heraldic escutcheon of the Luxembourg and Roubaix families in the lower margin. Text on facing page.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Nimbed Holy Woman, possibly Mary Magdalen or Martha of Bethany, wearing headdress, with joined hands raised, kneels before Christ, nimbed, with hands raised above shrouded figure of Lazarus, supine on ground beside grave. Behind Him, nimbed apostle and two figures, one wearing headgear with his back turned. Scene with large building with arched windows in background. Decorated initial D at beginning of Matins in Office of the Dead. Full border decorated with flowers, including violas and dianthus in decorated pot, inhabited by butterflies.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Abraham, seated on arc of heaven, holds on his lap nude soul of Lazarus, flanked by nude souls and two trees. Caption above, LAZARVS HIC ABRAHAE GAVDET GREMIO PATRIARCHAE. Below, soul of Dives, twice represented, is carried by Devil into flaming Hell, and again, sits in the flames, raising arms toward the Abraham above, surrounded by souls, devils, and Satan bound with chains. Caption at left, HIC GVTTA PETIIT QVI MICAS ANTE NEGAVIT. Rest of scene on fol. 76vo. Second of two illustrations for Gospel of First Sunday after Octave of Pentecost (Second Sunday after Pentecost). Double-page miniature. Rubric on preceding page and incipit on following page.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Martha and Mary of Bethany, both nimbed and veiled, walk behind Lazarus. Diapered background. Scene in half-circular vignette in left margin. Margins with ivy-rinceaux, foliate, and vinescroll ornament. Text is Psalms 97 and 98 (Ps. 96 and 97, Vulg.) from the third Nocturn of Matins in the Hours of the Virgin.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives (Luke 16:19-31) -- Before building, veiled woman, and Dives, holding knife and bowl, with feet on footstool, both sit behind table, on which are bowl and leaves, approached by servant holding bowl. Outside the door, two dogs lick sores of nude Lazarus, kneeling with left hand raised. Caption above, ANTE FORES HVIVS LAZARVS IACET VLCERE PLENVS. Below, devil grasps soul issuing from mouth of Dives reclining on bed, his head held by devil. Caption above, DIVES AD INFERNVM. To right, two nimbed angels carry soul of Lazarus above partly draped body, covered with sores, lying on ground. Caption above, LAZARVS VOLAT IN PARADYSV(M). Rest of scene on fol. 77ro. First of two illustrations for Gospel of First Sunday after Octave of Pentecost (now Second Sunday after Pentecost). Double-page miniature. Rubric on preceding page and incipit on following page.

Christ, Miracle of Raising Lazarus -- Christ, nimbus as rays, extending right hand in blessing toward Lazarus of Bethany, partly draped in shroud, with joined hands raised, and standing in grave. To left, group of five nimbed apostles, the foremost three with joined hands raised. All before church and other buildings. Initial D enclosing viola. Margins decorated with strewn flowers including viola and pea blossom, two skulls and effaced motto on scroll all against gold background. Miniature at beginning of Office of the Dead.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, crossed nimbus, extends right hand in blessing toward Lazarus, wrapped in shroud, standing on fallen door of tomb behind him. Mary, nimbed, prone, left hand extended to left (?) foot of Christ. Martha, nimbed, with joined hands, kneels between Christ and Lazarus, looking up at Him. Crowd of men, some wearing hats, one holding draped left hand to face, stand behind Christ. Hilly landscape and buildings of city in distance. Text from John 11:38-46, Miracle of raising Lazarus, is on fol. 11v.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Four men, each with pearled nimbus, surrounding Christ, pearled crossed nimbus, roll in left hand, right hand extended toward Lazarus upright in tomb, end of winding sheet held by man, pearled nimbus, left hand to nose; below, Mary, face on foot of Christ, and Martha, both kneeling; to right, lid of sarcophagus; ornamental border.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Three apostles, one holding roll, all behind Christ, roll in left hand, right hand extended toward mummy of Lazarus nimbed, standing in sarcophagus before tomb hollowed out of mountain, flanked by two men, one raising sleeve to nose and unwinding the mummy; Mary and Martha, veiled, kneeling at feet of the Christ. Illustration for John 11:1-45 read on Sixth Saturday of Lent (Saturday of sixth week of Mark readings; Lazarus Saturday).

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Three apostles, one holding roll, all behind Christ, roll in left hand, right hand extended toward mummy of Lazarus nimbed, standing in sarcophagus before tomb hollowed out of mountain, flanked by two men, one raising sleeve to nose and unwinding the mummy; Mary and Martha, veiled, kneeling at feet of the Christ. Illustration for John 11:1-45 read on Sixth Saturday of Lent (Saturday of sixth week of Mark readings; Lazarus Saturday).

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Nimbed apostle raising draped left hand to nose, behind Christ, cross-nimbed, holding object in left hand and raising right hand in blessing toward Lazarus, in shroud, with joined hands raised, seated upright in sarcophagus, behind which are Martha and Mary, both of Bethany, nimbed, veiled, each with hand raised. Scene with gold background, within initial U decorated with foliate ornament and with foliate stems, one inhabited by magpie in lower margin.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus (John 11:43-44) -- Three apostles, one holding roll, attending Christ cross-nimbed, right hand extended towards Lazarus, name inscribed, in shroud upright in portal of tomb; two men, one holding nose; Mary and Martha kneeling at feet of Christ; portal stone; architectural setting.

Porch, portal, left (west) wall: Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives: Nimbed prophet or patriarch holding scroll, beside Abraham, pearled decorated nimbus, representing Paradise, holding soul of Lazarus in cloth, each seated on cushioned chair. To right, angel, pearled decorated nimbus, hands draped, raising soul of Lazarus (all but feet destroyed), above Lazarus, wearing cap, reclining under tree, clapper beside his head, his sores licked by two dogs, beside building in which is servant holding jug, extending bowl toward Dives, holding plate with both hands and wife, holding food to mouth with right hand, holding loaf or plate with left hand. Both seated behind draped table on which are two bowls and knife.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus (John 11:38-44) -- Six veiled women bending forward, three with hands extended, behind Mary and Martha veiled, prostrate at feet of Christ cross-nimbed, right hand extended toward Lazarus wearing transparent grave clothes, standing, hands on sides of rock-cut tomb; two kneeling men wearing loin cloths holding stone cover of the tomb; flowering plant.

1) Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Nimbed angel emerges from cloud, lifting nude soul of Lazarus with right palm of hand shown. Below, Lazarus, wearing hooded mantle, covered with leprous sores, with right hand raised, lies on ground, beside staff, purse, and cap. Abraham: representing Paradise -- To right, Abraham, rayed nimbus, white haired and bearded, sits on throne, holding orant nude soul of Lazarus in bosom. 2) Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dives, nude, lies in draped four-post bed. From his mouth emerges nude soul ascending between horns of green bestial devil, with fringed waist-bands, grasping both the soul and Dives. Chain around neck of the soul, with hands joined, is pulled by another bestial horned devil, with fringed waist-bands, departing to right. At right, bestial devil (upper part green), wearing pointed cap and fringed waist-bands, pushes down into flaming Hell Mouth Dives raising object in right hand toward his open mouth. He raises left hand toward horned devil, with horn at shoulder and face at genitals, forcing him down with hook. Scenes within decorated frames. Prefatory miniature.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Group of apostles, all in communication with each other, accompany Christ, pearled nimbus, extending right hand in blessing toward rocky tomb in which is bearded Lazarus as mummy, wrapped in swaddling bands. Male servant and Mary and Martha, veiled, on ground, the foremost kneeling at the feet of the Christ. In rocky background, group of three men before crenellated building. Frame. Preliminary miniature to Gospel Book.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Group of apostles, all in communication with each other, accompany Christ, pearled nimbus, extending right hand in blessing toward rocky tomb in which is bearded Lazarus as mummy, wrapped in swaddling bands. Male servant and Mary and Martha, veiled, on ground, the foremost kneeling at the feet of the Christ. In rocky background, group of three men before crenellated building. Frame. Preliminary miniature to Gospel Book.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Among group of standing men, one raises draped hands toward his nose, and another clasps his hands. Mary and Martha, both of Bethany, veiled, kneel with joined hands raised, behind Lazarus in shroud, rising in sarcophagus, with lid on side. Christ, decorated crossed nimbus, extends His right hand in blessing toward them and holds book in His left hand. Two nimbed apostles stand behind Him. Decorated frame.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, wearing hat and robe with shroud, with joined hands, stands in opening in floor, apostle, nimbed, bending over him, grasping part of the shroud with left hand. Lazarus looks up toward Christ, rays as cross nimbus, raising right hand in blessing. Mary and Martha, nimbed and veiled, one with wimple and with hands raised, kneel next to the grave also looking up toward Christ. In background is group of men, wearing hats, one holding cloth to face. Three or four apostles, nimbed, are behind Christ. Wall in background open to exterior with tower, steeple in distance; rays descending from above. Rubric on fol. 142v.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, with rays as nimbus, stands with right hand raised in blessing toward Lazarus, nimbed, draped in shroud, kneeling with joined hands raised beside lid of tomb and beside Mary of Bethany, nimbed, kneeling with joined hands raised. Nimbed apostles and Martha of Bethany, veiled, kneeling, witness scene. In background is building, possibly church with round apse with leaded-glass windows. Margins with architectural ornament. Escutcheon with arms of Jean Carondelet (azure a fasce and six bezants or en orle, an archiepiscopal cross in pale above the shield), with the motto MATURA and flanked by the initials IC.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, partially draped in shroud, emerges from sarcophagus, assisted from back by man wearing hat, and by Christ, rays as nimbus (?), grasping left arm of Lazarus with His right hand. Mary and Martha stand behind the sarcophagus, one wearing pointed headdress, and the other wearing headdress with veil, and her arms crossed on breast. In background are three men, two wearing hats, one holding hand to face, and one woman. Behind Christ are four (?) Apostles, three nimbed. People also watch from windows in background. Scene outside with buildings in background, decorated with architectural ornament. Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament including rose, columbine, and daisy, and inhabited by birds.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, partially draped in shroud, emerges from sarcophagus, assisted from back by man wearing hat, and by Christ, rays as nimbus (?), grasping left arm of Lazarus with His right hand. Mary and Martha stand behind the sarcophagus, one wearing pointed headdress, and the other wearing headdress with veil, and her arms crossed on breast. In background are three men, two wearing hats, one holding hand to face, and one woman. Behind Christ are four (?) Apostles, three nimbed. People also watch from windows in background. Scene outside with buildings in background, decorated with architectural ornament. Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament including rose, columbine, and daisy, and inhabited by birds.

1) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Apostle, holding book in draped left hand, and Apostle Peter, tonsured, both stand behind Christ, cross-nimbed, with book in draped left hand. He raises right hand in blessing toward Lazarus, in brown shroud, seated in sarcophagus, in front of group of standing men. One, with right hand raised, grasps with left hand Lazarus' right hand, and another, with his nostrils covered, places his hands on Lazarus' shoulders. 2) Christ: Entry into Jerusalem -- Three nimbed apostles, including tonsured Peter, follow Christ, cross-nimbed, raising right hand in blessing and holding reins with left hand, mounted on ass treading on garment spread by youth. Two men, wearing hats, hold palms and stand at city gate of Jerusalem, above which are six men, one grasping branch of tree, and another bearded, all behind crenellated wall. Scenes within decorated frames. Prefatory miniature.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Woman, and two other nimbed figures (only nimbi visible) stand behind Christ, crossed nimbus raising right hand in blessing, holding tripartite globe in left hand. He stands next to grave from which emerges Lazarus, with joined hands, partially draped in shroud. At end of grave, behind Lazarus, stand four men, wearing hats, one holding cloth to face. Scene in room with wood ceiling and window. Miniature in grisaille with gold and color detail. Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament, in grisaille with color detail, inhabited by bird.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Two men, including Peter (?), nimbed, tonsured, stand with Christ, with crossed rays as nimbus, raising right in blessing toward Lazarus, nimbed, partially draped in shroud, standing in open grave. Mary or Martha of Bethany, wearing headdress, kneeling, witnesses scene. Building in background. Margins with moth, scattered naturalistic flowers, including viola; bones; and skull. In left margin is scroll inscribed ROGITA MORI.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Two men, including Peter (?), nimbed, tonsured, stand with Christ, with crossed rays as nimbus, raising right in blessing toward Lazarus, nimbed, partially draped in shroud, standing in open grave. Mary or Martha of Bethany, wearing headdress, kneeling, witnesses scene. Building in background. Margins with moth, scattered naturalistic flowers, including viola; bones; and skull. In left margin is scroll inscribed ROGITA MORI.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, nimbed, shroud draped over one shoulder, right hand on breast, left hand grasping edge of sarcophagus lid, is seated on the lid, looking up toward Christ, rays as cross nimbus, raising right hand. Mary or Martha, nimbed, kneels between them. Two apostles, nimbed, stand behind Christ. In background, man wearing hat is behind sarcophagus; at right one of two men, wearing hat, holds right hand to face. Buildings, including church in background.

1) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Group of nimbed figures surrounding Christ cross-nimbed, roll in right hand, left hand raised toward Mary and Martha, both of Bethany, each nimbed, veiled, one bowing, the other prostrate; to right, nimbed male figures, including one with draped right hand covering nose and left hand indicating Lazarus nimbed, wrapped in grave clothes, another carrying tomb cover; additional nimbed witnesses on fol. 12r; inscriptions, How Our Lord raised Lazarus; How Mary and Martha prostrated themselves at the feet of Our Lord; The Jews who came to console them; and How he opens the burial, holding his nose because of the corruption (all Geez); below, 2) Christ: Entry into Jerusalem -- Twelve nimbed apostles, one holding cross-staff and swinging cross-surmounted censer, surrounding Christ cross-nimbed, mounted on ass, right hand extended, book in left hand; to right, two youths extending palm branches (scene continued on fol. 12r); inscriptions, How they cried Hosana; Our Lord riding upon the foal of an ass and He came to Jerusalem with His twelve disciples; and the elders and the children met him carrying branches of palm (both Geez). Prefatory miniature.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ stands with right hand raised in blessing to Lazarus, partially draped in shroud, seated at edge of grave beside kneeling apostle. Large group of people, including hooded men, two veiled women, Mary of Bethany, kneeling with joined hands raised, and apostles, witness scene. Scene in enclosed graveyard with gravestones on ground. In background are buildings of city. Margin with floreate ornament, including dianthus.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus (John 11:43-44) -- Two apostles, one possibly Peter, both nimbed, accompanying Christ cross-nimbed, inscribed IC XC, left hand holding roll, right hand raised toward mummy of Lazarus nimbed issuing from tomb hollowed out of mountain; attendant, draped right hand to nose, holding wrapping cord of the mummy; Martha and Mary nimbed, prostrate at feet of the Christ; portal stone to right.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus (John 11:43-44) -- Two apostles, one possibly Peter, both nimbed, accompanying Christ cross-nimbed, inscribed IC XC, left hand holding roll, right hand raised toward mummy of Lazarus nimbed issuing from tomb hollowed out of mountain; attendant, draped right hand to nose, holding wrapping cord of the mummy; Martha and Mary nimbed, prostrate at feet of the Christ; portal stone to right.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Peter (?) and John (?), both nimbed, stand behind Mary, nimbed, veiled, holding covered jar, and Martha, nimbed, veiled, with joined hands raised, beside Christ, with crossed rays as nimbus, raising right hand to Lazarus, nimbed, partially draped in shroud, kneeling (?) with joined hands raised. Miniature enclosed in camaïeu frame with angels and other figures in gothic niches. Lower margin with foliate ornament and bird with outstretched wings.

Zone 1: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus, Messenger (John 11:3) -- Within building, Mary and Martha, both of Bethany, seated on bench, one holding head and the other holding hand of Lazarus reclining on mattress; to right, messanger holding tau-staff in left hand, with right hand indicating the Lazarus to Christ, crossed pearled nimbus, beardless, raising right hand and holding roll in left hand, beside two apostles, one holding book. inscription above, MISERVNT SORORES LAZARE AD IHM DICENTES. D(OMI)NE ECCE QVEM AMAS INFIRMATVR based on John 11:3. Zone 2: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus, met by Martha, and met by Mary (John 11:20-27, 32) -- Three apostles, two holding books, and Apostle Peter foremost, following Christ, crossed pearled nimbus, beardless, holding roll in left hand, approaching Martha and Mary, both of Bethany, veiled, one kneeling, the other bowing, all flanked by four Jews, one holding roll, before buildings; inscription above, MARTHA ET MARIA VT AVDERVNT QVIA IHS VENIT. OCCURRERVNT EI, based on John 11:20. Zone 3: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus (John 11:38-44) -- Group of men following Mary and Martha, both of Bethany, veiled, beside Christ, crossed pearled nimbus, beardless, holding roll in left hand, and raising right hand toward Lazarus in winding sheet, rising from sarcophagus before three men, two lifting lid, and one covering nose. inscription above, DIXIT IHS. TOLLITE LAPIDE(M). VT ERGO TVLER(VNT). IHS CLAMAVIT VOCE MAGNA. LAZARE VENI FORAS. ET STATIM PRODIIT, from John 11:39, 41, 43-44.

ZONE 3: 1a) Mary of Bethany and Martha, Comforted -- Within building, two veiled women comfort Mary of Bethany and Martha, both veiled, one seated on bench. Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus, met by Mary, and Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus, met by Martha -- To right, Martha, veiled, stands, and Mary lies prostrate at feet of Christ, cross-nimbed, beside four men, one holding book or roll. 1b) Christ, Miracle of Raising Lazarus -- Three men stand behind Mary and Martha, both of Bethany, veiled. Christ, cross-nimbed, extends right hand toward nimbed apostle, possibly Peter, grasping winding bands of mummy of Lazarus rising from sarcophagus. Three men, two holding drapery against noses, hold cover of sarcophagus. 2a) Christ, Sending for Ass, and Apostles, Fetching Ass -- Six apostles, one nimbed, stand behind Christ, cross-nimbed, with book in left hand and right hand extended toward two nimbed apostles. One of two nimbed apostles grasps ass standing beside foal, before man standing in city gate. 2b) Christ, Entry into Jerusalem -- Group of followers stands behind Christ, cross-nimbed, seated astride ass, treading on garment, and riding toward seven men, one holding garment, others holding palms, two atop city gate of Jerusalem. 3a) Judas Iscariot, Receiving Silver -- Horned devil perches on shoulder of Judas, nimbed, standing before man holding scroll. Within temple, two of four seated men holding scrolls. 3b) Judas Iscariot, Receiving Silver -- Horned devil perches on shoulder of Judas, nimbed, standing beside three men. To right, devil perches on shoulder of Judas, nimbed, receiving coins from man who receives coins from man beside chest in front of Temple in which lamp hangs. Scenes in frames decorated with abstract ornament. Prefatory miniature.

ZONE 3: 1a) Mary of Bethany and Martha, Comforted -- Within building, two veiled women comfort Mary of Bethany and Martha, both veiled, one seated on bench. Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus, met by Mary, and Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus, met by Martha -- To right, Martha, veiled, stands, and Mary lies prostrate at feet of Christ, cross-nimbed, beside four men, one holding book or roll. 1b) Christ, Miracle of Raising Lazarus -- Three men stand behind Mary and Martha, both of Bethany, veiled. Christ, cross-nimbed, extends right hand toward nimbed apostle, possibly Peter, grasping winding bands of mummy of Lazarus rising from sarcophagus. Three men, two holding drapery against noses, hold cover of sarcophagus. 2a) Christ, Sending for Ass, and Apostles, Fetching Ass -- Six apostles, one nimbed, stand behind Christ, cross-nimbed, with book in left hand and right hand extended toward two nimbed apostles. One of two nimbed apostles grasps ass standing beside foal, before man standing in city gate. 2b) Christ, Entry into Jerusalem -- Group of followers stands behind Christ, cross-nimbed, seated astride ass, treading on garment, and riding toward seven men, one holding garment, others holding palms, two atop city gate of Jerusalem. 3a) Judas Iscariot, Receiving Silver -- Horned devil perches on shoulder of Judas, nimbed, standing before man holding scroll. Within temple, two of four seated men holding scrolls. 3b) Judas Iscariot, Receiving Silver -- Horned devil perches on shoulder of Judas, nimbed, standing beside three men. To right, devil perches on shoulder of Judas, nimbed, receiving coins from man who receives coins from man beside chest in front of Temple in which lamp hangs. Scenes in frames decorated with abstract ornament. Prefatory miniature.

Upper register: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Apostle Peter, nimbed, with right forefinger raised, stands behind Christ, rays as nimbus, raising right hand in blessing and extending left hand toward Lazarus, partially draped in shroud, emerging from grave, with joined hands raised. Behind him kneel Mary and Martha, both of Bethany, nimbed, holding jars in their left hands. In background are group of men, two of which are nimbed. Three cover their noses with their sleeves. Seven wear hats. Only tops of heads of most are visible. Scene in front of wall with open portal. Right margin: Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Abraham, wearing hat, seated in draped chair, holds in his lap soul of Lazarus, nude, on draped cloth, with joined hands raised. They are within coud-edged arc of heaven, above Dives, nude, with chain attached to collar around his neck, raising his right forefinger to indicate his mouth. He is seated amid bestial devils, rocks, and fires of hell. Lower register: Purgatory -- Of four nude souls amid flames, one is tonsured with crossed hands, two have arms crossed, and fourth has crossed hands and addresses angel, extending right forefinger and left hand. Faces of three other souls (in red camaïeu technique) are in flames. Miniatures within architectural frame. Incipit on preceding page.

Upper register: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Apostle Peter, nimbed, with right forefinger raised, stands behind Christ, rays as nimbus, raising right hand in blessing and extending left hand toward Lazarus, partially draped in shroud, emerging from grave, with joined hands raised. Behind him kneel Mary and Martha, both of Bethany, nimbed, holding jars in their left hands. In background are group of men, two of which are nimbed. Three cover their noses with their sleeves. Seven wear hats. Only tops of heads of most are visible. Scene in front of wall with open portal. Right margin: Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Abraham, wearing hat, seated in draped chair, holds in his lap soul of Lazarus, nude, on draped cloth, with joined hands raised. They are within coud-edged arc of heaven, above Dives, nude, with chain attached to collar around his neck, raising his right forefinger to indicate his mouth. He is seated amid bestial devils, rocks, and fires of hell. Lower register: Purgatory -- Of four nude souls amid flames, one is tonsured with crossed hands, two have arms crossed, and fourth has crossed hands and addresses angel, extending right forefinger and left hand. Faces of three other souls (in red camaïeu technique) are in flames. Miniatures within architectural frame. Incipit on preceding page.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, rays as nimbus, extends right hand in blessing toward Lazarus, draped in burial cloth, with joined hands raised, rising up out of sarcophagus, his hands grasped by Apostle Peter, nimbed. In foreground is lid from sarcophagus. In background, left, stand group of five (?) Apostles, nimbed, some only nimbus visible. At right are Mary and Martha, nimbed and veiled (?) with wimple, one with joined hands, and three men, two with hands covering noses. Scene in room decorated with architectural ornament, open through double arch, to view in distance of street flanked by houses. In initial D, head of skeleton.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, nude, with left hand raised, emerges from coffin or sarcophagus, lid across top. Next to him, Mary or Martha of Bethany kneels, with right hand raised, looking up toward Christ, raising right hand in blessing. At left is group of men, most wearing hats, one holding liripipe to face; behind Christ, are either Mary or Martha, apostles, one holding book with right hand and mantle to face with left hand, and other men, most only heads visible. Figures before building; church in background. Margins are decorated with border of floreate ornament, including daisies.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, with rayed nimbus, standing with three apostles with rayed nimbi, including Peter, tonsured, raises right hand in blessing to Lazarus, partially draped in shroud, with joined hands raised, emerging from grave. Beside the grave kneels Mary or Martha of Bethany, with rays as nimbus, wearing turban. Scene in decorated initial B. Margins with vinescroll ornament, violas, and roses, inhabited by two birds. Rubric on fol. 31v.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Nimbed Apostles stand behind Christ, with rays as nimbus, gesturing. Apostle Peter kneels on ground in front of Christ with his hands on shoulder of Lazarus, partially draped in shroud, with hands bound, emerging from grave. Two men, wearing hats, and two women, probably Martha and Mary of Bethany, including one with rays as nimbus and wearing headdress, all witness scene. City with towers and turrets in background. Margins with vinescroll and floreate ornament.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, with joined hands raised, his body partially draped, emerges from grave. Mary and Martha, nimbed, one holding ointment jar with right hand and indicating Lazarus with left hand, and the other raising right hand and holding ointment jar with left hand, kneel next to the grave. They both look toward Christ, rays as cross nimbus, raising right hand in blessing, standing at end of the grave. Behind Him are four apostles, including Evangelist John and Peter, both nimbed. At left stand five (?) men, wearing hats, one covering mouth with right hand and another raising left hand to face. Margins decorated with floreate border including roses, and inhabited by fantastic animal

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, with joined hands raised, his body partially draped, emerges from grave. Mary and Martha, nimbed, one holding ointment jar with right hand and indicating Lazarus with left hand, and the other raising right hand and holding ointment jar with left hand, kneel next to the grave. They both look toward Christ, rays as cross nimbus, raising right hand in blessing, standing at end of the grave. Behind Him are four apostles, including Evangelist John and Peter, both nimbed. At left stand five (?) men, wearing hats, one covering mouth with right hand and another raising left hand to face. Margins decorated with floreate border including roses, and inhabited by fantastic animal

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Woman, wearing headdress, and two men, wearing hats, one gesturing with both hands, one with hands raised, stand at end of open grave. Lazarus, nude, partially draped, is standing in the grave with joined hands raised. He looks up toward Christ, rays as crossed nimbus, raising right hand in blessing, indicating Lazarus with left hand. Scene in walled yard outside of church and open portal, landscape beyond; two figures, one with crutch, in background. Margins decorated with border including fly, skull, bones, and flowers, viola and thistle .

Miniature: Job: seated among Ashes -- Job, nude, arms crossed at breast, is seated on ashes beside three friends, wife with arms crossed at breast, and second woman. Figures within landscape in which male figure, possibly horned, supporting himself with cane, right hand extended, encounters woman, wearing veil and wimple (Job: Messenger reporting?). Margins with historiated border containing the following continuous scene: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- In lower border, group of figures, including Mary of Bethany, kneeling with arms extended, and Martha of Bethany, covering mouth with draped hand, stand beside grave, with cover removed, from which Lazarus, wearing shroud, is pulled by man, kneeling on one knee, grasping his right hand. Christ, nimbed, extends right hand toward Lazarus. Behind him stand group of figures within arch of building decorated with statues of angels, one playing harp and the other viol, and three male figures within niches.

Miniature: Job: seated among Ashes -- Job, nude, arms crossed at breast, is seated on ashes beside three friends, wife with arms crossed at breast, and second woman. Figures within landscape in which male figure, possibly horned, supporting himself with cane, right hand extended, encounters woman, wearing veil and wimple (Job: Messenger reporting?). Margins with historiated border containing the following continuous scene: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- In lower border, group of figures, including Mary of Bethany, kneeling with arms extended, and Martha of Bethany, covering mouth with draped hand, stand beside grave, with cover removed, from which Lazarus, wearing shroud, is pulled by man, kneeling on one knee, grasping his right hand. Christ, nimbed, extends right hand toward Lazarus. Behind him stand group of figures within arch of building decorated with statues of angels, one playing harp and the other viol, and three male figures within niches.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Nimbed Apostle stands behind Christ, with crossed nimbus, gesturing to man, wearing chaperon hat, removing cover of sarcophagus. Beside the sarcophagus are Martha and Mary of Bethany, both nimbed, veiled, and holding their mantles over their noses. Scene in medallion in right margin. Margins with ivy-rinceaux, foliate, and vinescroll ornament. Rubric on fols. 78v-79r.

Panel 1: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Before mountain, two apostles accompanying Christ cross-nimbed, roll in left hand, right hand extended toward Lazarus nimbed, in mummy bands, upright in sarcophagus in front of building, flanked by group of Jews and two servants, one with right hand holding kerchief to nose, left hand grasping end of the mummy bands, other holding lid of the sarcophagus; in foreground, Mary of Bethany prostrate, kissing left foot of the Christ, and Martha of Bethany, seated on ground; title inscription. Panel 2: 1) Christ: Bewailing -- Christ nimbed, nude, reclining on cloth, supported and embraced by Virgin Mary nimbed, veiled, seated on ground, accompanied by Evangelist John stooping, kissing left hand of the Christ, Nicodemus, and Joseph of Arimathea, hands veiled, both kneeling at His feet; landscape background; below, 2) Christ: Harrowing of Hell -- Eve, veiled hands raised, behind Adam kneeling, right hand grasped by Christ cross-nimbed, right hand raised, trampling on Satan, ankles fettered, prostrate in flames, near broken gates, bolt, and hinges of Hell; to right, David and Solomon, both crowned, and John Baptist nimbed; entrance of hell and mountains; above, title inscription.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, nimbed, raising right hand in blessing, stands opposite Lazarus, wrapped in shroud, emerging from sarcophagus, held by nimbed man. Woman, nimbed, with joined hands, kneels next to Christ. Covered vessel is on ground before her. Behind her, man, nimbed, holds fold of his mantle to his nose. Behind Christ stand group of Apostles, nimbed, most only top of head or nimbus visible. Scene in landscape. Miniature enclosed in architectural frame decorated with sculptural ornament in camaïeu including skull with snake passing through eye sockets; scroll inscribed DVM TEMPVS HABE; scroll inscribed PEREREMVS O; bones hanging on cords; heads of fantastic animals; fire in oven (?) burning bones.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, nimbed, raising right hand in blessing, stands opposite Lazarus, wrapped in shroud, emerging from sarcophagus, held by nimbed man. Woman, nimbed, with joined hands, kneels next to Christ. Covered vessel is on ground before her. Behind her, man, nimbed, holds fold of his mantle to his nose. Behind Christ stand group of Apostles, nimbed, most only top of head or nimbus visible. Scene in landscape. Miniature enclosed in architectural frame decorated with sculptural ornament in camaïeu including skull with snake passing through eye sockets; scroll inscribed DVM TEMPVS HABE; scroll inscribed PEREREMVS O; bones hanging on cords; heads of fantastic animals; fire in oven (?) burning bones.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, nimbed, raising right hand in blessing, stands opposite Lazarus, wrapped in shroud, emerging from sarcophagus, held by nimbed man. Woman, nimbed, with joined hands, kneels next to Christ. Covered vessel is on ground before her. Behind her, man, nimbed, holds fold of his mantle to his nose. Behind Christ stand group of Apostles, nimbed, most only top of head or nimbus visible. Scene in landscape. Miniature enclosed in architectural frame decorated with sculptural ornament in camaïeu including skull with snake passing through eye sockets; scroll inscribed DVM TEMPVS HABE; scroll inscribed PEREREMVS O; bones hanging on cords; heads of fantastic animals; fire in oven (?) burning bones.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Two nimbed apostles and four men, including one raising his draped left hand toward his face and holding a book in his right hand, stand behind the cross-nimbed Christ. He holds a book with one strap in His left hand and raises His right hand toward Lazarus wearing a shroud, with his joined hands raised, emerging from a sarcophagus with a lid removed to the side.To right are three women, including Martha of Bethany and Mary of Bethany, one raising joined hands. Scene with patterned background, within Gothic arcade and foliate frame decorated with cusps of foliate terminals, and four heraldic shields, including Moreuil (two), in four of six medallions (two as halves). Text on facing page.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Two Apostles and group of people behind Christ bearded, cross-nimbed; Mary and Martha kneeling at feet of Christ; group of spectators and three attendants, two bending towards Christ, one covering nose with garment and supporting mummy of Lazarus upright in portal of rock tomb: below, David, Hosea, David, and Isaiah, each with name inscribed, nimbed, David also crowned, holding open inscribed rolls, those of David with I Samuel 2:6 (LXX, I Kings 2:6) and Psalm 77:14 (LXX, 76:15), that of Hosea with Hosea 13:14, that of Isaiah with Isaiah 26:19. Prefatory miniature.

Scene, Liturgical: Obsequies -- Tomb, decorated with statues or reliefs in niches on the sides, is surrounded by: three horses, men holding bannered spears; four mourners or monks, wearing hoods, dressed in black robes; and three men wearing headgear. At upper right are two clerics, one holding crozier, the other with right hand on gold disk, possibly paten, held also by left hand of bishop, wearing miter and vestments. They stand before altar on which is chalice and candlestick, and behind which is reredos. Scene in canopied, windowed, architectural frame. Eight men visible outside center window, possibly singing. Through left window, possibly vestment of hat of cardinal hanging over tomb. Above on pendants, two statues. Lower margin, in circle of foliage: Lazarus: Death -- Lazarus, nimbed, reclines on bed, surrounded by six men and women. Right margin, in circles of foliage (bottom to top): 1) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus, met by Martha -- Christ, cross-nimbed, draped in mantle, holding staff in right hand and raising left hand stands by Martha (?), nimbed. Behind them is draped casket. 2) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, cross-nimbed, draped in mantle, holding bannered cross staff in left hand, stands before Lazarus, draped, emerging from casket. Margins decorated with border of foliate and floreate ornament, inhabited by peacocks.

Scene, Liturgical: Obsequies -- Tomb, decorated with statues or reliefs in niches on the sides, is surrounded by: three horses, men holding bannered spears; four mourners or monks, wearing hoods, dressed in black robes; and three men wearing headgear. At upper right are two clerics, one holding crozier, the other with right hand on gold disk, possibly paten, held also by left hand of bishop, wearing miter and vestments. They stand before altar on which is chalice and candlestick, and behind which is reredos. Scene in canopied, windowed, architectural frame. Eight men visible outside center window, possibly singing. Through left window, possibly vestment of hat of cardinal hanging over tomb. Above on pendants, two statues. Lower margin, in circle of foliage: Lazarus: Death -- Lazarus, nimbed, reclines on bed, surrounded by six men and women. Right margin, in circles of foliage (bottom to top): 1) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus, met by Martha -- Christ, cross-nimbed, draped in mantle, holding staff in right hand and raising left hand stands by Martha (?), nimbed. Behind them is draped casket. 2) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, cross-nimbed, draped in mantle, holding bannered cross staff in left hand, stands before Lazarus, draped, emerging from casket. Margins decorated with border of foliate and floreate ornament, inhabited by peacocks.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, with rays as nimbus, raises right hand in blessing toward Lazarus, nimbed, draped in robe or shroud, seated with joined hands raised in sarcophagus. Beside the sarcophagus kneel Mary and Martha of Bethany, both nimbed and veiled. On tile floor beside them is covered jar. In background stand nimbed Apostles and two men, wearing pointed hats, one with his mantle raised to his face. Landscape with hills and buildings visible through arched openings in arcade in background. Miniature enclosed in architectural frame, with pilasters with Corinthian capitals and decorative panels. In lower margin: Scene, Liturgical: Burial -- Man, wearing hat, standing in stone tomb or sarcophagus, holds in both hands body of Carthusian monk, wrapped in shroud or habit. Flanking the tomb are six monks, all wearing Carthusian habits, including one holding aspergil, one holding open book, and one holding closed book. In background are three cemetery crosses, including two with crucifixes, and arcade.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, with rays as nimbus, raises right hand in blessing toward Lazarus, nimbed, draped in robe or shroud, seated with joined hands raised in sarcophagus. Beside the sarcophagus kneel Mary and Martha of Bethany, both nimbed and veiled. On tile floor beside them is covered jar. In background stand nimbed Apostles and two men, wearing pointed hats, one with his mantle raised to his face. Landscape with hills and buildings visible through arched openings in arcade in background. Miniature enclosed in architectural frame, with pilasters with Corinthian capitals and decorative panels. In lower margin: Scene, Liturgical: Burial -- Man, wearing hat, standing in stone tomb or sarcophagus, holds in both hands body of Carthusian monk, wrapped in shroud or habit. Flanking the tomb are six monks, all wearing Carthusian habits, including one holding aspergil, one holding open book, and one holding closed book. In background are three cemetery crosses, including two with crucifixes, and arcade.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, nude body partially draped in burial cloth, is seated at end of grave, his left hand grasped by Apostle Peter, kneeling beside the grave. Christ, rays as crossed nimbus, raising right hand in blessing, looking toward Lazarus, stands amid two apostles, nimbed, and Mary and Martha, one veiled with wimple, the other wearing contemporary headdress. Two men, one wearing hat, each raising draped hand to face, stand at right. Scene in city, with church in background and other buildings in distance. Margins decorated with floreate ornament including larkspur (?), rose, forget-me-not (?), viola, bellflower (?), and strawberry and inhabited by flies.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, nude body partially draped in burial cloth, is seated at end of grave, his left hand grasped by Apostle Peter, kneeling beside the grave. Christ, rays as crossed nimbus, raising right hand in blessing, looking toward Lazarus, stands amid two apostles, nimbed, and Mary and Martha, one veiled with wimple, the other wearing contemporary headdress. Two men, one wearing hat, each raising draped hand to face, stand at right. Scene in city, with church in background and other buildings in distance. Margins decorated with floreate ornament including larkspur (?), rose, forget-me-not (?), viola, bellflower (?), and strawberry and inhabited by flies.

Central Apse, side wall: Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Lazarus, name inscribed (fragment), tau-staff in left hand, leaning against half open door, sores licked by dog; above, feet of two figures (rest destroyed), possibly angels carrying soul of Lazarus to Abraham's bosom; seated man, right hand raised to head, possibly Dives in Hell.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Two men, including one covering mouth with his hand, look on as Lazarus, nimbed, partially shrouded, rises from grave. Christ, rayed nimbus, gestures towards him with His right hand. Apostles, including Apostles Peter and Paul, all nimbed, and Mary and Martha of Bethany, both nimbed and kneeling, look on. Sarcophagus lid, on ground beside grave, is inscribed with pseudo-inscriptions. Figures stand in front of church facade decorated with two statues of female figures flanking statue of Virgin Mary and Christ Child, both seated, within niche. Scene framed by border with four skulls within illusionistic architectural niches.

Miniature: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Apostle Peter, Evangelist John and Christ, all, nimbed, with right hands raised, stand behind Martha of Bethany, nimbed, wearing headcovering with berbette, with joined hands raised, and Mary of Bethany, nimbed, with hands raised. Before them, Lazarus, partly in shroud, is seated at edge of grave. At right stand two men, both wearing hat, one with his arms around the other. In background, city. Margins decorated with border of floral and foliate ornament, inhabited by bird with wings spread and by owl. In lower margin, covered cross (burial cross).

Prefatory miniature, three registers: Zone 1: Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- In building, man, veiled woman, and Dives, name inscribed, all seated at draped table on which are loaves and vessels, approached by servant extending vessel; outside the door, Lazarus, name inscribed, kneeling, covered with sores licked by two dogs. Inscription above. Zone 2: Two nimbed angels holding cloth, descending from arc of heaven, grasping soul issuing from mouth of Lazarus, name inscribed, lying on ground; to right, Abraham, seated on arch, holding soul of Lazarus, flanked by two groups of souls standing, and four trees. Inscription above. Zone 3: Before building, veiled woman and three men flanking Dives, name inscribed, lying on bed, issuing soul from his mouth grasped by two winged devils; his soul, again represented, carried by winged devil toward flaming Hell, inscribed; to right, in flames, soul of Dives raising arms toward the Abraham above, surrounded by groups of the damned, devils, and Satan bound with chains. Inscription above.

Miniature: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Eight apostles, nimbed, possibly including Peter, with joined hands, and Evangelist John, most only nimbus visible, stand behind Christ, crossed nimbus. His right hand is extended in blessing gesture toward Lazarus, wearing white hood and garment, with joined hands raised, standing at opening of tomb inscribed LAZARE VENI FO [...]. Also with Christ is youth wearing hat, holding staff with left hand and indicating Lazarus with right hand. Mary or Martha, nimbed, kneels in foreground. Margins: 1) Medallion enclosing skull, crowned, resting on crossed bones. 2) Half-figure of skeleton, crowned, wearing cape, holding skull with both hands. 3) Half-figure of Francis of Assisi, nimbed and tonsured, wearing habit, raising right hand, and looking toward skull held with left hand. Frame flanked by four skulls. Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament inhabited by winged putti heads, skulls, and hybrid man with dragon body.

Initial E: Psalm 081 (Vulg., 080). Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, cross-nimbed, raises right hand in blessing and with left hand grasps left arm of shrouded Lazarus rising from sarcophagus, before two flanking groups of three men wearing pointed caps, two raising mantles to their noses, and three veiled women, including Mary and Martha of Bethany, one clasping hands. Scene beneath double trefoil arches, within decorated initial E, decorated with marginal rectilinear foliate bars and balls, one formed by winged hybrid man entwined by serpent, and another with terminal of hybrid man wearing cap and scrolling tendrils enclosing scene (described below). In lower margin (bas-de-page): Absalom: Death -- Absalom, wearing chain mail, mounted on horse, with lance under his right arm transfixes torso of Absalom, with left hand on sheathed sword, hanging by hair from one of the foliate tendrils; his saddled horse runs away.

Initial E: Psalm 081 (Vulg., 080). Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, cross-nimbed, raises right hand in blessing and with left hand grasps left arm of shrouded Lazarus rising from sarcophagus, before two flanking groups of three men wearing pointed caps, two raising mantles to their noses, and three veiled women, including Mary and Martha of Bethany, one clasping hands. Scene beneath double trefoil arches, within decorated initial E, decorated with marginal rectilinear foliate bars and balls, one formed by winged hybrid man entwined by serpent, and another with terminal of hybrid man wearing cap and scrolling tendrils enclosing scene (described below). In lower margin (bas-de-page): Absalom: Death -- Absalom, wearing chain mail, mounted on horse, with lance under his right arm transfixes torso of Absalom, with left hand on sheathed sword, hanging by hair from one of the foliate tendrils; his saddled horse runs away.

Upper register: Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Abraham, nimbed, wearing bicolored garment, with left hand raised and with right hand holding palm, is seated on ground with Lazarus, wearing hat or crown, cross-legged in the Abraham's lap, with both hands extending palms. At far right, nimbed angel, wearing bicolored garment, raising right hand to face; patterned background. Lower register: Man reclining on platter placed on fire is entwined with serpent, with both hands raised toward the Abraham. At lower left, hybrid dog-like animal blowing on flames; dark background.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, right hand raised in blessing, extends left hand toward Lazarus, wearing cap, hands extended and crossed, possibly bound, body partially draped, seated on slab. Man, probably Peter, kneeling, extends hands to Lazarus, and looks up toward Christ. Woman, with joined hands extended, kneels at end of the slab looking up toward Christ. Two men and two (?) women, one wearing hat, with hands raised, stand behind Christ. At right, one of three men, wearing turban like headdress, covers face with draped hand. The other two men, wear hats; all look toward Christ. Scene in area enclosed by low wall, with courtyard surrounded by buildings, and stream in background; hills and trees in distance. Margins decorated with floreate ornament in camaïeu border decorated with vine scroll; in upper left corner, skeleton, partially draped, grasping the drape with right hand, holding arrow with left hand, next to scroll possibly inscribed IR SIT IPAER NYEMANT DIE IAER LEIJET.

Miniature: Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dives and woman are seated at table, draped with cloth with pseudo-inscriptions, with platter with meat, loaf and bowls. Beside table, man supports himself with staff. Two dogs, followed by third, lick wounds of Lazarus, legs wrapped and bleeding, standing within doorway. He holds clapper in right hand and keg in left hand. Margins: Below miniature, historiated border frames text. In left border, God, rayed cross as nimbus, seated amid clouds emitting rays of light, holds nude soul of Lazarus, hands raised in prayer. Below, demons, amid flames, some winged, torment nude soul of Dives.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- One of two devils grasps shoulder of nude Dives, and the other with right hand raises grapnel and with left hand grasps left arm of the Dives, all engulfed by flames in Hell. Above, Abraham, wearing hat decorated with gold, holds cloth in which is half figure of nude personified soul of Lazarus with joined hands, both in gold aureole, in heaven. Margins decorated with full borders of foliate and floreate ornament, including thistles; right margin inhabited by winged fantastic animal with jaws open, and bird; lower margin inhabited by two facing cocks, one with spread wings, and moth. Rubric on fol. 165v.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- One of two devils grasps shoulder of nude Dives, and the other with right hand raises grapnel and with left hand grasps left arm of the Dives, all engulfed by flames in Hell. Above, Abraham, wearing hat decorated with gold, holds cloth in which is half figure of nude personified soul of Lazarus with joined hands, both in gold aureole, in heaven. Margins decorated with full borders of foliate and floreate ornament, including thistles; right margin inhabited by winged fantastic animal with jaws open, and bird; lower margin inhabited by two facing cocks, one with spread wings, and moth. Rubric on fol. 165v.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, rays as nimbus, right hand raised in blessing, looks toward Lazarus, with joined hands, partially draped, standing in grave next to grave stone inscribed TAE LAZER. To left of Christ are man wearing hat, and holding walking stick, and Apostle, nimbed, looking toward the man and raising left hand. At right of Christ is probably Mary or Martha, nimbed, wearing headdress, with joined hands, kneeling. Scene is in walled area with church (?); in distance is landscape with trees, figures on road, body of water and city. Margins decorated with border of floreate and foliate ornament including pea, viola, rose, strawberry, thistle, and grapes. Rubric and incipit on following page.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Man, wearing cap, kneels beside open grave in which sits Lazarus, partially draped, his hands being unbound by the kneeling man. Before the grave is lid of sarcophagus. Behind the kneeling man stands another man, wearing cap, possibly leaning on shovel (?) held in right hand and with left hand on breast. Lazarus turns to look at Christ, with crossed rays as nimbus, standing with right hand raised in blessing and surrounded by nine figures, including two nimbed apostles; woman, probably Martha or Mary of Bethany, wearing hat, standing with joined hands; and six men wearing hats. In background, before city houses, is a man wearing pointed hat, and small dog. Lower margin decorated with scattered flowers, including viola, strawberry, cherry, and creeping bellflower; and bones, including hipbone (?), on which rests fly, femur (?), skull, vertebra, and jawbone. Rubric on fol. 99v.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Man, wearing cap, kneels beside open grave in which sits Lazarus, partially draped, his hands being unbound by the kneeling man. Before the grave is lid of sarcophagus. Behind the kneeling man stands another man, wearing cap, possibly leaning on shovel (?) held in right hand and with left hand on breast. Lazarus turns to look at Christ, with crossed rays as nimbus, standing with right hand raised in blessing and surrounded by nine figures, including two nimbed apostles; woman, probably Martha or Mary of Bethany, wearing hat, standing with joined hands; and six men wearing hats. In background, before city houses, is a man wearing pointed hat, and small dog. Lower margin decorated with scattered flowers, including viola, strawberry, cherry, and creeping bellflower; and bones, including hipbone (?), on which rests fly, femur (?), skull, vertebra, and jawbone. Rubric on fol. 99v.

Confessio Amantis: Scene, Lazarus and Dives -- Woman, wearing turban type of headdress with jewel and fur lined gown, raising right hand and extending left, is seated next to Dives, wearing brimless hat with jewel and fur trimmed cloak, holding knife on table with right hand and raising left hand. They are seated behind draped table on which are two covered vessels, and dish. Behind them on another draped table are three other vessels. Opposite them is manservant holding spear with left hand and his upturned right hand on the table. At end of the table are three dogs, one licking left leg of Dives, nimbed, entering doorway, wearing hat and tunic, holding bell in right hand and dish with left hand. At right, outside in background, Lazarus, represented again, nimbed, wearing brown hat and tunic, reclines on ground; bust of red angel holds soul emerging from mouth of Lazarus. Scenes in room with decorated wall, wood ceiling and tile floor, and in landscape with blue sky. Champide initial O with spray-work. Illustration from Book 6 of John Gower, Confessio Amantis.

Chapel of St. Nicholas, Bay 4, west wall, zone 1 Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Within architectural setting, Dives wearing headdress, holding cup, woman and two men seated at table on which are vessels and utensils, served by servant extending cup on tray (banquet); below table, dog licking sores of Lazarus, seated on floor, wearing hat.

Front: 1) Scene: unidentified, possibly Apostle Paul: Execution -- Figure with hands bound behind back; soldier unsheathing sword; 2) Christ: Entry into Jerusalem -- Christ riding astride; youth spreading garment, another in tree; 3) Christ: teaching -- Christ holding half open roll, seated on rock; to left, Peter pointing to open book; to right, bearded apostle (restoration), and beardless apostle holding roll; 4) Daniel: in Lions' Den -- Habakkuk holding platter of loaves; Daniel nude, orant, flanked by two lions; 5) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ holding rod; mummy upright in gabled tomb with steps and wreath with lemnisci in pediment.

1) Christ: Miracle of healing Blind Born (John 1:1-41) -- Five nimbed apostles, including Apostle Peter, tonsured, with right hand raised, all attend Christ, cross-nimbed, holding book in left hand and extending right hand to eyes of Blind born, partly hooded, kneeling, with staff in joined hands raised, beside three men, one gesturing. 2) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Four apostles, three nimbed, all stand behind Christ, cross-nimbed, holding book in draped left hand and raising right hand before Lazarus, partly shrouded, stepping forward with joined hands raised from sarcophagus in front of veiled woman, possibly Mary of Bethany or Martha of Bethany, raising draped to nose, beside four men, three raising draped hands to faces, all standing. Scenes against gold backgrounds, within decorated frames of two registers. Prefatory miniature.

Miniature: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, nude, draped with shroud, rises from grave, his bound hands being loosed by man, nimbed. At left are three women, including Mary and Martha, all nimbed and veiled, one holding mantle to nose, with men in background. At right, Christ, cross-nimbed, right hand raised in blessing, stands beside grave in front of three men wearing hats, two indicating Lazarus, one with purse at waist. Tools lie on ground near grave, including shovel and mattock. Scene in landscape with building and trees in background. Medallions in margins, from bottom to top: 1) Lazarus: Scene, Death -- Lazarus, reclines in draped, canopied bed, his head on pillow. Above his head hangs mirror. Beside bed are: cleric, tonsured, wearing cope, raising aspergil in right hand; woman, nimbed, holding lighted candle with joined hands; and two men, one with joined hands. At foot of bed is another man, with joined hands. Ointment jar (?) rests on bed. Scene in room with tiled floor, and chair next to bed. 2) Scene, Liturgical: Obsequies -- Bier is draped with cross-inscribed (?) pall, with candlesticks at three corners and processional cross at left end. At left is altar, draped, on which is candle stick, chalice and open book, behind which is retable and above which is canopy. Behind bier stand three mourners, hooded. At right two clerics, tonsured, wearing copes, stand at lectern, one resting right hand on open book on lectern. 3) Scene, Liturgical: Burial -- Body, wrapped in shroud, either sewn or cross-inscribed, is lowered into grave by two men. Shovel lies on ground next to grave. Behind them, stand priest, tonsured, wearing cope, holding open book in right hand, flanked by three mourners, hooded, wearing black, and by acolyte (?) carrying processional cross, another cleric, tonsured, and man wearing hat, resting right hand on left shoulder of cleric. Margins decorated with floreate ornament including strawberry, and inhabited by birds, including owl, and bird chasing insect, possibly fly.

Miniature: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, nude, draped with shroud, rises from grave, his bound hands being loosed by man, nimbed. At left are three women, including Mary and Martha, all nimbed and veiled, one holding mantle to nose, with men in background. At right, Christ, cross-nimbed, right hand raised in blessing, stands beside grave in front of three men wearing hats, two indicating Lazarus, one with purse at waist. Tools lie on ground near grave, including shovel and mattock. Scene in landscape with building and trees in background. Medallions in margins, from bottom to top: 1) Lazarus: Scene, Death -- Lazarus, reclines in draped, canopied bed, his head on pillow. Above his head hangs mirror. Beside bed are: cleric, tonsured, wearing cope, raising aspergil in right hand; woman, nimbed, holding lighted candle with joined hands; and two men, one with joined hands. At foot of bed is another man, with joined hands. Ointment jar (?) rests on bed. Scene in room with tiled floor, and chair next to bed. 2) Scene, Liturgical: Obsequies -- Bier is draped with cross-inscribed (?) pall, with candlesticks at three corners and processional cross at left end. At left is altar, draped, on which is candle stick, chalice and open book, behind which is retable and above which is canopy. Behind bier stand three mourners, hooded. At right two clerics, tonsured, wearing copes, stand at lectern, one resting right hand on open book on lectern. 3) Scene, Liturgical: Burial -- Body, wrapped in shroud, either sewn or cross-inscribed, is lowered into grave by two men. Shovel lies on ground next to grave. Behind them, stand priest, tonsured, wearing cope, holding open book in right hand, flanked by three mourners, hooded, wearing black, and by acolyte (?) carrying processional cross, another cleric, tonsured, and man wearing hat, resting right hand on left shoulder of cleric. Margins decorated with floreate ornament including strawberry, and inhabited by birds, including owl, and bird chasing insect, possibly fly.

Miniature: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, nude, draped with shroud, rises from grave, his bound hands being loosed by man, nimbed. At left are three women, including Mary and Martha, all nimbed and veiled, one holding mantle to nose, with men in background. At right, Christ, cross-nimbed, right hand raised in blessing, stands beside grave in front of three men wearing hats, two indicating Lazarus, one with purse at waist. Tools lie on ground near grave, including shovel and mattock. Scene in landscape with building and trees in background. Medallions in margins, from bottom to top: 1) Lazarus: Scene, Death -- Lazarus, reclines in draped, canopied bed, his head on pillow. Above his head hangs mirror. Beside bed are: cleric, tonsured, wearing cope, raising aspergil in right hand; woman, nimbed, holding lighted candle with joined hands; and two men, one with joined hands. At foot of bed is another man, with joined hands. Ointment jar (?) rests on bed. Scene in room with tiled floor, and chair next to bed. 2) Scene, Liturgical: Obsequies -- Bier is draped with cross-inscribed (?) pall, with candlesticks at three corners and processional cross at left end. At left is altar, draped, on which is candle stick, chalice and open book, behind which is retable and above which is canopy. Behind bier stand three mourners, hooded. At right two clerics, tonsured, wearing copes, stand at lectern, one resting right hand on open book on lectern. 3) Scene, Liturgical: Burial -- Body, wrapped in shroud, either sewn or cross-inscribed, is lowered into grave by two men. Shovel lies on ground next to grave. Behind them, stand priest, tonsured, wearing cope, holding open book in right hand, flanked by three mourners, hooded, wearing black, and by acolyte (?) carrying processional cross, another cleric, tonsured, and man wearing hat, resting right hand on left shoulder of cleric. Margins decorated with floreate ornament including strawberry, and inhabited by birds, including owl, and bird chasing insect, possibly fly.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, cross-nimbed, with right hand raised in blessing, stands in front of group of nimbed figures and beside Virgin Mary, holding scroll inscribed LASARUM VENI FORAS from John 11:43, accompanied by two Holy Women, one with hands crossed on breast. At right, two men, wearing headgears, one with cloth in right hand raised to face, at front of group of figures. Scene in room with windows and tile floor, between two arches. Scene above decorated initial D at beginning of Office of the Dead. Margins decorated with border of foliate and floreate ornament, including strawberries, and inhabited by bird.

Upper vignette: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ raises right forefinger and extends left hands toward Lazarus, partially drapped, kneeling (?) with joined hands raised. Behind are three men, wearing hats, one with hand covering nose, and woman, wearing veil, with joined hands raised. Scene in landscape setting, within architectural frame. Lower vignette: Elisha: raising Son of Shunammite Woman -- Shunammite woman, veiled, sits with joined hands raised, beside bed, upon which reclines infant, nude. At right, Elisha leans over bed and touches the infant with his left hand. Scene in room, within architectural frame. Caption between vignettes reads, HELISEE DONNA SECOURS AU FILS MORT QUO LUI PRESENTA IESUS AUSSI RESSUSCITA LE LAZARE MORT DE TROPS IOURS. Margins decorated with floreate border, including violas, daisies, and roses, inhabited by bird. Scroll with pseudo-inscription in left margin. Text is the end of the Te deum at the completion of Matins in the Hours of the Virgin.

Upper vignette: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ raises right forefinger and extends left hands toward Lazarus, partially drapped, kneeling (?) with joined hands raised. Behind are three men, wearing hats, one with hand covering nose, and woman, wearing veil, with joined hands raised. Scene in landscape setting, within architectural frame. Lower vignette: Elisha: raising Son of Shunammite Woman -- Shunammite woman, veiled, sits with joined hands raised, beside bed, upon which reclines infant, nude. At right, Elisha leans over bed and touches the infant with his left hand. Scene in room, within architectural frame. Caption between vignettes reads, HELISEE DONNA SECOURS AU FILS MORT QUO LUI PRESENTA IESUS AUSSI RESSUSCITA LE LAZARE MORT DE TROPS IOURS. Margins decorated with floreate border, including violas, daisies, and roses, inhabited by bird. Scroll with pseudo-inscription in left margin. Text is the end of the Te deum at the completion of Matins in the Hours of the Virgin.

Miniature: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- In church graveyard, Lazarus, partly shrouded, with joined hands raised, rises from sarcophagus, in front of Mary Magdalen, nimbed, kneeling with joined hands raised, both facing Christ, rays as nimbus, raising right hand in blessing, accompanied by Apostle Peter and Evangelist John, both nimbed. In left background, two men, wearing hats, raise draped hands toward their noses, standing before gate. Church and trees in background. Margins: Full borders decorated with roses. Incipit on fol. 51v.

Miniature: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- In church graveyard, Lazarus, partly shrouded, with joined hands raised, rises from sarcophagus, in front of Mary Magdalen, nimbed, kneeling with joined hands raised, both facing Christ, rays as nimbus, raising right hand in blessing, accompanied by Apostle Peter and Evangelist John, both nimbed. In left background, two men, wearing hats, raise draped hands toward their noses, standing before gate. Church and trees in background. Margins: Full borders decorated with roses. Incipit on fol. 51v.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Apostle Peter, scalloped nimbus, accompanies Christ, cross-nimbed (?), extending right hand in blessing and gathering garments in left hand, before Lazarus, nude, partly draped with shroud, with joined hands raised, emerging from ground beside shovel. Behind them, woman, scalloped nimbus, wearing wimpled veil, possibly Mary or Martha of Bethany, with joined hands raised, stands surrounded by three men, wearing hats, one with his back turned. Scene in landscape with trees and crenellated wall of building in background. Borders decorated with gold scrolling foliate and floreate ornament against blue background. Miniature for Vespers beginning of the Office of the Dead. Rubric on fol. 94r. Incipit on fol. 94r.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Man wearing hat, with sword at waist, grasps lid resting across sarcophagus from which emerges nude Lazarus, with joined hands, partially draped with shroud. He looks toward Christ, nimbed, right hand raised in blessing, standing with two apostles, nimbed, next to the sarcophagus. Woman, probably Mary or Martha, wearing headdress and wimple, with joined hands is at head of the sarcophagus. One of five men, wearing hats in background indicates Lazarus with right hand and covers face with left hand; of the other four, three hats are only visible, and the fourth indicates Christ with left hand. Scene in landscape within wall, skull in foreground; in background, hill with trees and city in distance. Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament including daisy and strawberry, and inhabited by boar in left margin, wearing spectacles, seated before distaff on stand, holding cord to spindle with right front foot, and by man partially wearing hood in lower margin, holding club with left hand and with right hand, chain attached to bear wearing muzzle, possibly Scene, Sports and Games: Animal-training.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Man wearing hat, with sword at waist, grasps lid resting across sarcophagus from which emerges nude Lazarus, with joined hands, partially draped with shroud. He looks toward Christ, nimbed, right hand raised in blessing, standing with two apostles, nimbed, next to the sarcophagus. Woman, probably Mary or Martha, wearing headdress and wimple, with joined hands is at head of the sarcophagus. One of five men, wearing hats in background indicates Lazarus with right hand and covers face with left hand; of the other four, three hats are only visible, and the fourth indicates Christ with left hand. Scene in landscape within wall, skull in foreground; in background, hill with trees and city in distance. Margins decorated with border of floreate ornament including daisy and strawberry, and inhabited by boar in left margin, wearing spectacles, seated before distaff on stand, holding cord to spindle with right front foot, and by man partially wearing hood in lower margin, holding club with left hand and with right hand, chain attached to bear wearing muzzle, possibly Scene, Sports and Games: Animal-training.

Margin, upper: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Beneath rays and starry sky, two nimbed apostles and Mary of Bethany (?), nimbed, accompany Apostle Peter, nimbed, tonsured, supporting Lazarus, wearing short loin cloth, with joined hands, emerging from grave, before Christ, decorated crossed nimbus, with right hand raised in blessing, standing in front of the grave and three men, wearing hats, one covering nose. Scene in landscape with hill and trees beyond. Arched vignette withing block border of floreate and foliate decoration, including roses. Margin, lower: Absalom: Death (?) -- Bearded centaur draws arrow in bow toward back of Absalom (?), name erroneously inscribed SAUL REX, crowned, with his hair caught in tree, and mounted on bridled white horse (only rear visible) departing toward group of soldiers (only tops of heads visible) behind hill, some holding spears (link with Zodiac Sign: Sagittarius). Scene in hilly landscape with path and trees. Square vignette within block border of floreate and foliate decoration, including currants. Block border at left margin of floreate and foliate decoration, including daisies.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dives, crowned, holding knife, sits at table; in foreground, partly nude Lazarus, gesturing, lies before dog licking him. Scene against gold background within initial D. Beginning of collect for First Sunday after Pentecost.

Cubiculum 19, vault: In the central medallion, 1) Good Shepherd standing, holding syrinx in right hand and pedum in left hand, flanked by two sheep and two trees; in the surrounding compartments, 2) Christ: Miracle of Loaves -- Christ standing in the center, flanked by two baskets of bread at left and three baskets of bread at right; 3) Moses: smiting Rock -- Moses with rod in right hand striking rock from which water flows; 4) Christ: Miracle of Cana? -- Christ standing, holding rod in His extended right hand, flanked by seven? amphora on each side; 5) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- At left, Lazarus, wrapped in grave bands, standing upright at the entrance to a tomb with a gabled roof; to the right, Christ extending rod to Lazarus' head; alternating with these scenes are 6) Four orants, two male and two female, veiled; at the corners, four birds perched on branches.

1) Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- In initial S decorated with geometric ornament and foliate spandrels, a nimbed angel, emerging from clouds of heaven, grasps the nude personification of soul emerging from the mouth of Lazarus, afflicted with sores, in a hooded garment with two sacks and water jug on his right arm, hands joined, reclining. Below, a bestial devil grasps the nude personification of soul emerging from the mouth of Dives wearing a kerchief, lying on a draped bed. Beside the bed are a female mourner wearing a hat and raising her right hand to her face, and a male mourner raising his right hand to his face. 2) Margins - Rectilinear bars decorated with interlace and foliage, enclosing four French heraldic shields, including Moreuil (two), and inhabited by two confronting hybrid animals, a rabbit, three birds, including a parrot, and a two-headed hybrid man wearing a hat.

Miniature: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, nimbed, partially draped with shroud, emerges from grave, with joined hands raised, and looks up toward Christ, rays as nimbus, right hand raised in blessing. He is followed by three apostles, nimbed, one with joined hands. Woman, nimbed, wearing turban type of headdress, with joined hands raised stands next to grave looking toward Christ. In background, two men, wearing hats, cover their noses with sleeves. Brick wall and church in background. Margins: 1) Scene, Sports and Games: Hunting -- Man, wearing hat, blowing horn, carrying staff with left hand, walks amid trees with two dogs, one black and one white. 2) Legend, Three Living and Dead -- Two of three Dead flank processional cross; all are crowned, with skeletal faces, looking and aiming spears, toward figures on following folio. The miniature falls at the beginning of the Office of the Dead.

Miniature: Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, nimbed, partially draped with shroud, emerges from grave, with joined hands raised, and looks up toward Christ, rays as nimbus, right hand raised in blessing. He is followed by three apostles, nimbed, one with joined hands. Woman, nimbed, wearing turban type of headdress, with joined hands raised stands next to grave looking toward Christ. In background, two men, wearing hats, cover their noses with sleeves. Brick wall and church in background. Margins: 1) Scene, Sports and Games: Hunting -- Man, wearing hat, blowing horn, carrying staff with left hand, walks amid trees with two dogs, one black and one white. 2) Legend, Three Living and Dead -- Two of three Dead flank processional cross; all are crowned, with skeletal faces, looking and aiming spears, toward figures on following folio. The miniature falls at the beginning of the Office of the Dead.

Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, crossed nimbus as rays, with right hand raised in blessing before Lazarus, partly draped in cloth, with joined hands raised, and standing up in grave, both surrounded by two onlookers, one wearing Jew's hat, the other behind him, both raising draped right hands to their faces, possibly Apostles Peter, tonsured, kneeling, possibly James, and Evangelist John, and possibly Mary or Martha, wearing turban-like headgear, also kneeling with joined hands raised. Scene before castle-like building and trees. Margins decorated with borders of strewn flowers including wild rose, currant, and acorn, and scattered bones and three skulls. Miniature facing the beginning of Office of the Dead, with Psalm 114 in Vespers. Rubric and incipit on fol. 121r.

Cubiculum O: Left wall, spandrels: Garland. Left wall, niche, vault: Garland of flowers and sheaves of grain issuing from two baskets. Left wall, niche, lunette (central part destroyed): Moses: receiving Law; Moses: Pillar of Fire; and Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Moses on mount, right hand raised toward Hand of God holding tablets, issuing from clouds, beside flames issuing from column; below, fourteen disciples following Christ, with staff in right hand touching Lazarus as mummy upright in triangular-gabled tomb; another tomb, with steps, to right. Left wall, niche, left wall: Scene: unidentified; possibly Balaam: prophesying Star of Jacob; or Apocalypse: Christ sending Angel to John -- Figure, possibly Balaam or Evangelist John, right hand indicating star. Left wall, niche, right wall: Daniel: in Lions' Den -- Daniel nude, orant, flanked by two lions.

ZONE 4: 1a) Christ: delivering Adulteress -- Three scribes and Pharisees, wearing hats, with three nimbed apostles, including Peter, stand beside Christ, cross-nimbed, with book in left hand, raising right forefinger, facing man holding right wrist of veiled adulteress; group of men, including one holding stone, stand behind the adulteress. 1b) Christ: delivering Adulteress -- Four nimbed apostles, one holding standard, stand beside Christ, cross-nimbed, writing with right forefinger on ground before veiled adulteress; behind her are pile of stones and group of men, one holding stone, departing to right. 2a) Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Rich man, holding knife and bowl, is flanked by two veiled women, one holding bowl and the other holding loaf; all sit at table on which are cross-inscribed loaves, knife, cup and jar; in foreground, kneeling servant offers fish in platter. At doorway, two dogs lick sores of Lazarus leaning on staff.
