To right, nimbed angel emerges from arc of heaven, carrying on cloth soul of Lazarus; below, Lazarus, covered with sores, lies dead in bed on ground. 2b) Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Flying winged demon grasps soul of rich man, above Dives lying dead in bed, before female attendant. To right, Abraham, seated in arc of heaven, holds soul of Lazarus in bosom; below, two demons torture Damned with pitchforks in flaming Hell. 3a) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Father, seated on bench, gives object to prodigal son standing before him. Prodigal son, with bundle on staff over shoulder, walks off to right. Within building, two veiled women flank prodigal son, holding cup; all sit at table on which are loaves, one cross-inscribed, and two bowls. 3b) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Prodigal son, holding staff, sits on hillock tending swine. To right, prodigal son is embraced by father taking ring from servant holding garment. 3c) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Servant with axe kills fattened calf. To right, prodigal son, father holding bowl, two men, and two musicians holding rebec and hurdy-gurdy sit at draped table on which are loaves and bowls (banquet). To right, father, wearing cap, addresses elder son. Scenes in frames decorated with abstract ornament. Prefatory miniature.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dog licks leg of Lazarus, wearing trousers, covered with wounds, lying on ground, raising his left hand toward draped table, laden with three fishes in bowls, loaves, knife and covered dish, behind which is Dives, crowned, extending his right hand, seated with guests, including three women, one wearing berbette, and man holding vessel. Scene within architectural setting. Illustration preceding Gospel reading of Luke 16:19 for First Sunday after Pentecost. Incipit on preceding page.

Front, zone 1: 1) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ bearded, right hand destroyed, attended by apostle; mummy of Lazarus upright in gabled tomb with steps; Martha and Jew standing, Mary kneeling; 2) Apostle, Peter: smiting Rock -- Peter striking rock with rod; three men drinking from stream of water; 3) Apostle, Peter: Arrest -- Tree; two men seizing Peter, arms outstretched; three prostrate disciples; 4) Shepherd holding staff; two sheep in sheepfold. Front, zone 2: 1) Jonah: cast overboard -- Two fishermen on land, holding basket; Personifications of Sun crowned, and Wind (altered in restoration) above ship; helmsman and two mariners, one lowering Jonah nude into mouth of sea monster; fish in sea; 2) Noah in Ark -- Noah in ark on sea; dove with branch; 3) Jonah: cast up -- Jonah nude, arms extended, emerging from mouth of sea monaster; 4) Jonah: under Gourd Vine -- Jonah nude, reclining under gourd vine; 5) Scene, Occupational: Fishing -- Fisherman holding fish on line, and rod and basket; companion; wading bird; fishes and crab in sea.

Left margin: Border of foliate ornament in which is bust of man, possibly Lazarus. Lower margin: Legend, Dance of Death -- On horseback and on ground, soldiers, armed with lance and/or shields, in battle with, or escaping from, skeletons. One skeleton holding sword, grasps with extended left hand head of soldier astride rearing horse, raising lance with right hand left hand around neck of the horse; skeleton grasps hand of one of two soldiers on rearing horses; skeleton, standing with right foot on fallen horse, aiming spear at soldier on the horse, raising shield with left hand, holding sword with right hand; skeleton raising spear with right hand, grasping hair of soldier astride horse riding next to another soldier, wearing shield on back and holding lance with right hand, astride galloping horse. At far right, man, wearing hood, leaning on crutch stands looking on. Scene continued from facing page. Text is from Office of the Dead, Matins

1) Christ: Scene -- Christ, cross-nimbed, departing to left, turning head toward right, raising left hand before crown offered by one of five men. Caption above scene, HIC UISU(M) SIGNU(M) CENSET DIADEMATE DIGNU(M). 2) Christ: rejected at Nazareth -- At portal of city gate of Nazareth, one of several men pushing away Christ, cross-nimbed, holding book, departing to left. Illustration of Luke 04:29. Caption above scene, PRECIPITEM IACERE DOMINUM FERA GENS UOLUERE. 3) Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Lazarus, half-nude, covered with sores, seated on ground, resting head on crutch in left hand, and with right hand extending bowl toward three dogs in front of Dives with left hand raised, at portal of city gate. Illustration of Luke 16:19-21. Caption below scene, LAZARUS HIC PLORANS MICAS PANIS PETIT ORANS. 4) Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Abraham, nimbed, white-haired and bearded, seated, holding white cloth in which are four nude souls, including that of Lazarus with hand raised; in Hell, Dives, nude, pointing to mouth with left hand, glancing up, and with rope around neck, pushed by devil into Hell Mouth in which are the Damned, beside fantastic animal, possibly dragon. Illustration of Luke 16:22-24. Caption below scene, DELICIIS PLENU(M) STUPET HIC QUEM SPREUIT EGENUM. Scenes within decorated frames.

Miniature, upper left: 1) Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Emerging from open Hell Mouth, Dives wearing hat, orant, is flanked by two devils, with tongues protruding, one is crowned and one lowers crown to the head of the Dives. Miniature, lower left: 2) Christ: Parable, Great Supper (Luke 14:17) -- Beside building enclosed by wattle fence, two men walk, one raises right hand and looks back to the other, wearing hat. Caption above miniature: DER II SUNTAG NOCH DER TRINITAT DER ERST SPRACHICH HAN EIN DURFF KOUFFT. Miniature, upper right: 3) Christ: Parable, Great Supper (Luke 14:19)-- Man, wearing hat, is beside another, bearded man gesturing, both behind five oxen. Miniature, lower right: 4) Christ: Parable, Great Supper (Luke 14:20) -- Veiled woman accompanied another woman, with hands crossed at wrists, confronted by man raising right hand toward her. Another man is partly visible in background. Caption above miniature: DER DRITTE HETT EIN WIP GENOMEN. Miniatures are proofs for Bernard Richel's Der Spiegel der menschlichen Behältnis (Basel: 1476) with biblical quotes, commentary, and abbreviated extracts written in German for Christ's Parables and scenes between Chapters 42 and 43.

Miniature, upper left: 1) Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Emerging from open Hell Mouth, Dives wearing hat, orant, is flanked by two devils, with tongues protruding, one is crowned and one lowers crown to the head of the Dives. Miniature, lower left: 2) Christ: Parable, Great Supper (Luke 14:17) -- Beside building enclosed by wattle fence, two men walk, one raises right hand and looks back to the other, wearing hat. Caption above miniature: DER II SUNTAG NOCH DER TRINITAT DER ERST SPRACHICH HAN EIN DURFF KOUFFT. Miniature, upper right: 3) Christ: Parable, Great Supper (Luke 14:19)-- Man, wearing hat, is beside another, bearded man gesturing, both behind five oxen. Miniature, lower right: 4) Christ: Parable, Great Supper (Luke 14:20) -- Veiled woman accompanied another woman, with hands crossed at wrists, confronted by man raising right hand toward her. Another man is partly visible in background. Caption above miniature: DER DRITTE HETT EIN WIP GENOMEN. Miniatures are proofs for Bernard Richel's Der Spiegel der menschlichen Behältnis (Basel: 1476) with biblical quotes, commentary, and abbreviated extracts written in German for Christ's Parables and scenes between Chapters 42 and 43.

Description from bottom to top: 1) Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- In room with decorated walls and stone floor, Dives, wearing hat, raising right hand, and his wife, veiled, both sit on bench (?) behind draped table on which are loaves, knife, plates and bowls containing food. Before the table are two servants, wearing hats and short tunics, one carrying plate with food, the other carrying bowl. Outside of room servant indicates Lazarus, reclining on mattress (?), his hands joined. Two dogs lick his knee and foot. Above him, angel hovers, holding small nude body with raised arms. Crenellated wall is in background. 2) Group of nude women and men, three with joined hands, standing in room carved from rock (Limbo). 3) In room carved from stone, Dives, nude, indicating mouth with right hand, sitting on flames, wears collar around his neck. Two chains are attached to the collar, each pulled in opposite direction by winged devil. They are surrounded by nude figures, one tonsured with hands crossed on breast, in flames. Third winged devil, standing amid souls, raises rod; and fourth devil stands amid souls (Hell). 4) Abraham: representing Paradise -- In room carved from stone, Abraham, wearing hat is seated on bench (?), raising right hand, holding nude figure on lap. Before them a group of men, some wearing hats, one nude, one holding harp, and one holding lamb or dog, and women, some wearing hats, one nude, all look toward another man, right hand raised. 5) In room carved from stone, two angels stand in flames with nude men and women, some with joined hands, some with hands crossed on breast (Purgatory). Rubric and incipit on fol. 132v.

1) Personification of Virtue, Sobriety, labeled SOBRIETE, crowned, veiled, with right hand raised indicating disk, enclosing dove, held in right hand, and treading on crouching bear or lion; 2) Personification of Vice, Gluttony, labeled GLOUTONNIE, as male figure, wearing cap, vomiting, with right hand raised to throat and with left hand extended to draped table set with pitcher, goblet, knife, fish in bowl, boar's head on plate, and loaves, behind which he sits on bench with back (Scene, Secular: Banquet); 3) Personification of Moderation, as male figure, with knife in right hand cutting loaf in left hand, seated (?) behind draped table set with fish in bowl, knife, plate, food, and pitcher (banquet), beside seated pet dog looking up, all beneath trefoil arch; 4) Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dives, wearing cap, with right hand raised toward woman wearing snood, with right hand raised and left hand on food, both seated on bench with back behind draped table set with pitcher, food in two plates, two cups, knife, loaves, and utensils, all beneath trefoil arch; to right, at portal, male servant wearing draped hat, with stick beating Lazarus, wearing pilgrim's hat, with clapper in left hand and lamp (?) in right hand, his legs covered with sores licked by two dogs, standing at portal of house. All compartments with gold dotted backgrounds, within decorated frame and foliate cornerpieces. Below the frame, 5) Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dives, nude, wearing cap, with right hand indicating mouth, in cauldron over fire, flanked by two horned devils, each working bellows (Dives in Hell); scene within framed compartment; caption below, LE RICHE HOMME AUER.

Cubiculum IV, left wall: Moses: removing Sandals -- Moses beardless, removing sandal. Left wall, arcosolium, lunette: Daniel: in Lions' Den (destroyed). Cubiculum IV, back wall: 1) Micah: prophesying Coming of Christ (Micah 5:2 ff.) -- Micah, right hand raised toward Virgin Mary holding Christ Child, seated before buildings representing Bethlehem; 2) Moses: smiting Rock -- Moses with rod striking rock from which water flows; tree. Back wall, arcosolium, lunette: Orpheus seated, holding lyre and plectrum, surrounded by animals, camel, ox, dromedary. Cubiculum IV, right wall: 1) Orant female; 2) Noah: in Ark -- Noah orant, in ark on water; 3) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, right hand raised toward mummy of Lazarus (almost entirely destroyed) upright in tomb with steps. Cubiculum IV, right wall, arcosolium, lunette: Elijah: Ascension -- Elijah (almost entirely destroyed) in quadriga; Elisha receiving mantle; spectator. Cubiculum IV, entrance wall: Job, seated. Cubiculum IV, vault: Bust of Christ, bearded, in medallion surrounded by olive branches and vases of flowers; in corners, four doves holding olive branches.

Cubiculum, back wall, arch: To left, 1) Female orant; to right, 2) Male orant. Cubiculum, back wall, arcosolium, lunette: Scene, Liturgical: Agape -- Five male figures, four holding goblets, behind sigma couch before which is tripod with animal paw legs, on which is platter with fish, flanked by male figure striding forward, with right hand extending platter on which is object, and female Personification of Peace, inscribed IRENE, holding goblet and pitcher; to left, column surmounted by vessel, and foliage. Cubiculum, left wall, arcosolium, lunette: Scene, Liturgical: Agape -- Four men, one holding cup, behind sigma couch in front of which is draped tripod on which is platter with fish; to right, female Personification of Love inscribed AGAPE MISCE, holding cup and cloth. Cubiculum, vault: In central wreath medallion, 1) Good Shepherd (head destroyed), sheep over shoulders, flanked by sheep and trees; in surrounding compartments, 2) Job seated on bench; 3) Scene, Liturgical: Baptism -- Male figure, bending forward, right hand on head of small figure (catechumen) in water; 4) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Mummy of Lazarus in triangular-gabled tomb with steps; Christ touching the mummy with rod in right hand; 5) Moses: smiting Rock -- Moses with rod striking rock from which water flows; 6) Christ: Miracle of healing Paralytic -- Only paralytic, bed on shoulders, represented; 7) Daniel: in Lions' Den -- Daniel nude, orant, flanked by two lions; 8) Christ: Miracle of Loaves -- Christ, standing, with rod touching one of seven baskets filled with bread; 9) Noah: in Ark -- Dove with branch above Noah orant in ark in water; in corners, 10) Medallions enclosing ornamental heads flanked by birds and putti.

West facade: Frieze, left to right: 1) Judas: receiving Silver -- Priest, seated on faldstool, looks toward and extends right hand dropping coins into left hand of Judas, flanked by two other men; third man stands behind the priest. At left two men stand close together, both gesturing. 2) Christ: Purging of Temple -- Next to temple, Christ, crossed nimbus, raising right hand, pushes with left hand, man holding object. Of three other men, one holds two birds, possibly doves, one raises left hand, and the third holds sack with right hand. In foreground are two oxen (?), ram and sheep. 3) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus, met by Martha, and met by Mary -- Next to tower, apostle follows Christ, crossed nimbus, left hand raised, right hand extended in blessing (?) toward Mary and Martha, veiled, kneeling, one with joined hands raised, the other with arms raised.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives (Luke 16:22-31) -- Abraham nimbed, seated on bench, holding Lazarus nimbed, flanked by groups of souls in Paradise represented by trees; cushioned bench; to right, rich man seated in flames of Hell.

Margin, right, top to bottom: 1) Christ: Temptation, 1st -- Devil with feet of bird, raises left hand, and extends rock with right hand to Christ, nimbed, raising right hand in blessing. 2) Christ: Miracle of Cana -- Figure and Virgin Mary (?), wearing wimpled veil, stand behind Christ, right hand raised. At right are woman and man. All are behind draped table on which are plates. Jugs of wine are on floor before table. 3) Christ: Miracle of healing Demoniac -- Christ, nimbed, raises right hand in blessing; man before Him extends right arm, his left held by another man. 4) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Lazarus, nimbed, partially draped with shroud, with joined hands raised, stands in tomb. Christ, nimbed, stands next to tomb, raising right hand in blessing. Two apostles, nimbed, stand behind Him. 5) Christ: anointed by Woman -- Christ, nimbed, raising right hand, is seated at draped table on which are vessels. He is flanked by two men wearing hats, one nimbed. Mary Magdalen is on floor before table. 6) Christ: Entry into Jerusalem -- Apostles follow Christ, nimbed, raising right hand, astride ass, approaching city gate. Before gate, man places garment before ass.  Margin, lower, left to right: 1) Half figure of prophet, wearing hat, with fur collar, raising left hand. 2) Half figure of sibyl, wearing wimpled veil, raising left hand. Architectural frame with columns, arches, vault.

Cubiculum I, vault (almost entirely destroyed): In central medallion, Good Shepherd (destroyed); in surrounding compartments, 2) destroyed; 3) Christ: Miracle of raising Lazarus (destroyed); 4) Jonah: under Gourd Vine -- Jonah nude, reclining under gourd vine; 5) Christ: Miracle of Loaves (destroyed); scenes alternate with 6) peacocks standing on globes in foliage; 7) doves with olive branches.

Descriptions of diptych scenes in three zones read from left to right, top to bottom. ZONE 1 (top): Left Wing: 1) Christ, Miracle of Raising Lazarus -- Christ, nimbed, holding book in left hand and raising right hand above Lazarus, shrouded, rising with joined hands raised from sarcophagus, before Mary and Martha, both of Bethany, veiled, nimbed, and another woman, two gesturing. 2) Christ, Entry into Jerusalem -- Three nimbed apostles, one holding palm and book, accompanying Christ, nimbed, holding book in left hand and raising right hand in blessing, seated astride ass treading on garment spread by one of two youths, the other taking off garment; in background, child clambering amid tree, beside three men appearing above ramparts of city gate of Jerusalem. Right Wing: 3) Christ, Washing of Feet -- Christ, unnimbed, kneeling before basin, washing foot of Apostle Peter raising right hand in protest toward his face turned away from Him; both flanked by and before eleven (?) apostles, some holding books, and one with head draped; all apostles, nimbed, seated. ZONE 2 (middle): 1) Christ, Last Supper -- Evangelist John resting his head on breast of Christ, nimbed, raising right hand in blessin, both flanked by nimbed eleven (?) apostles, two holding cups, one a pitcher, two holding loaves, all seated at draped table set with bowl and loaf, all behind Judas crouching, seizing fish, and receiving sop from Christ's left hand. 2) Christ, in Gethsemane -- Twelve apostles, some hooded, sleeping among trees; to right, Christ, nimbed (?), kneeling with joined hands raised toward God, unnimbed, emerging from clouds. ZONE 3 (bottom): 1) Christ, Betrayal and Arrest, and Peter the Apostle, Cutting off Ear of Malchus -- Four apostles, one nimbed, surrounding Apostle Peter, nimbed, sheathing sword, beside Judas kissing Christ, nimbed, with His right hand on ear of Malchus kneeling and His left arm seized by one of two soldiers, the other holding lantern. 2) Judas Iscariot, Hanged -- To right, entrails spilling from abdomen of Judas, wearing rent garment, with right hand indicating his abdomen and with left hand raised to rope with noose around his neck, hanging from bent tree. Christ, Crucifixion -- Christ, nimbed (?), with eyes closed, head inclined, wearing crown of thorns and long loin cloth, affixed with three nails to cross, flanked by Virgin Mary swooning in arms of two veiled Holy Women and Longinus the Soldier, wearing cap, kneeling, holding spear, and raising joined hands toward Him, and by Stephaton, wearing cap, holding bucket in left hand and extending sponge on reed toward His face, Evangelist John raising right hand to his face in mourning, and Jew or Longinus of Jerusalem (the Centurion), wearing cap, holding scroll and with right hand indicating Him, beside Jew, wearing cap. Each zone of each wing decorated with arcade of five trefoil arches with crockets above scenes.

Zone 1: 1) Christ, Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Christ, cross-nimbed, holds book in left hand and raises right hand above Lazarus, wearing shroud, stepping from sarcophagus, before two men, with heads draped, one holding garment to nose, and Mary and Martha, both of Bethany, veiled, one with hands raised. 2) Christ, Entry into Jerusalem -- Two apostles, one holding book, follow Christ, raising right hand in blessing, mounted on bridled ass beside foal, approaching youth holding branch in tree, in front of city gate of Jerusalem behind which are heads of man and woman wearing hat. 3) Christ, Washing of Feet -- Christ, cross-nimbed (?), kneels beside basin, holding right foot of Peter seated with right hand raised, both before six apostles, one with head draped, all seated. 4) Christ, Last Supper -- Evangelist John leans on breast of Christ, cross-nimbed, raising right hand in blessing and with left hand extending sop toward Judas grasping food and kneeling before table, draped with vessels and food, behind which are four apostles flanking Him. Zone 2: 5) Christ, in Gethsemane -- Christ, cross-nimbed, kneels with joined hands raised between two trees on mount below which are four apostles, two with heads draped, all seated, sleeping. 6) Christ, Betrayal and Arrest, and Apostle, Peter: cutting off Ear of Malchus -- Judas, with head draped, embraces Christ with right hand holding ear of Malchus, seated, flanked by Apostle Peter sheathing sword, three men, one wearing winged headgear, another armed with axe, and a third raising lantern, and two soldiers (?) armed with spears. 7) Christ, bearing Cross -- Virgin Mary, veiled, with left hand draped, holds right arm of cross borne by Christ over right shoulder, looking back, before man, wearing cap, holding three pegs or nails. 8) Christ, Crucifixion -- Christ, with eyes closed, wearing crown of thorns on inclined head, in long loin cloth, is affixed with three nails to cross with titulus, flanked by Virgin Mary, veiled, with head bent and breast pierced by sword, and Evangelist John, with right hand indicating book in left hand. Each scene in architectural frame of trefoil arch under gable with crockets and finial and spandrels pierced pair of pointed trefoils.

Descriptions of diptych scenes in three zones read from left to right, top to bottom. ZONE 1 (top): Left Wing: 1) Christ, Miracle of raising Lazarus -- Martha and Mary, both of Bethany, veiled, raising draped hands toward their noses, accompanied by another veiled woman and apostle, all behind Lazarus, shrouded, with joined hands raised, stepping from sarcophagus, before Christ, cross-nimbed, with right hand raised and book in left hand. 2) Christ, Entry into Jerusalem -- Apostle, holding book in right hand, accompanying Christ, cross-nimbed, holding book in left hand and raising right hand in blessing, seated astride ass treading on garment spread by one of two youths, the other taking off garment; in background, youth in tree throwing palm, beside city gate of Jerusalem, above which man and woman, wearing headdress (only heads visible), appear above ramparts. Right Wing: 3) Christ, Washing of Feet -- Six apostles, seated, two gesturing, one holding right foot, one holding book, all flanking Christ, cross-nimbed, wearing towel around waist, kneeling before basin, washing foot of Apostle Peter, seated, raising right hand in protest and turning face away from Him. ZONE 2: 4) Christ, Last Supper -- Evangelist John resting his head on breast of Christ, cross-nimbed, seated with nine apostles, some gesturing, at draped table set with bowls and loaves, raising His right hand in blessing, and with His left hand giving sop to mouth of Judas seizing fish from platter and crouching in front of the table. 5) Christ, in Gethsemane -- Christ, cross-nimbed, kneels with joined hands raised, amid ten apostles, some with heads draped, sleeping; trees. ZONE 3: 6) Christ, Betrayal and Arrest, and Apostle, Peter: cutting off Ear of Malchus -- Apostle Peter, sheathing sword, and apostle with right hand raised looking toward Judas embracing Christ, unnimbed (?), with His right hand on ear of Malchus crouching, and holding book in His left hand, beside man, wearing hat, placing right hand on His shoulder and holding shield, accompanied by two soldiers, wearing helmets, one armed with spear and the other raising lantern and holding halberd. 7) Judas Iscariot, hanged -- Entrails spilling from abdomen of Judas, wearing rent garment, hanging by rope from bent tree. 8) Christ, Crucifixion -- Christ, unnimbed, with eyes closed, head inclined, wearing crown of thorns and long loin cloth, affixed with three nails to cross, flanked at left by Virgin Mary, veiled, swooning in arms of two of three veiled Holy Women, and at right by Evangelist John raising right hand to face in mourning and holding book in left hand, and three men wearing pointed hats, two as Jews, and one possibly Longinus of Jerusalem (the Centurion) or Jew, holding scroll in left hand and raising right hand indicating Him. Each zone of each wing beneath arcade of five trefoil arches with finials and crockets.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dives, wearing ermine-lined hat and mantle with ermine collar, with right hand holding knife, beside woman wearing wrapped headdress, both seated behind draped table with eating vessels and salt cellar, in front of which are female servant, wearing wrapped headdress, holding platter, and male servant, with back turned, raising jug. In foreground, man, with dog at feet, approaches Lazarus, rays as nimbus, holding clapper in right hand and bowl in left hand, with his right foot licked by another dog. Scene in room with tile floor and window. Lazarus: Scene, Death -- Through the window, Lazarus, rays as nimbus, lies on hill, beneath rays descending from cloud. City in background. Miniature for Vespers of Office of the Dead. In lower margin: Fantastic animal, pierced with arrow, confronts archer, wearing hat, with right hand holding club over right shoulder, and bow in left hand. Margins decorated with full borders of foliate and floreate ornament, including thistles; right margin inhabited by bird; lower margin inhabited by fly, behind the archer. Text on facing page.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dives, wearing ermine-lined hat and mantle with ermine collar, with right hand holding knife, beside woman wearing wrapped headdress, both seated behind draped table with eating vessels and salt cellar, in front of which are female servant, wearing wrapped headdress, holding platter, and male servant, with back turned, raising jug. In foreground, man, with dog at feet, approaches Lazarus, rays as nimbus, holding clapper in right hand and bowl in left hand, with his right foot licked by another dog. Scene in room with tile floor and window. Lazarus: Scene, Death -- Through the window, Lazarus, rays as nimbus, lies on hill, beneath rays descending from cloud. City in background. Miniature for Vespers of Office of the Dead. In lower margin: Fantastic animal, pierced with arrow, confronts archer, wearing hat, with right hand holding club over right shoulder, and bow in left hand. Margins decorated with full borders of foliate and floreate ornament, including thistles; right margin inhabited by bird; lower margin inhabited by fly, behind the archer. Text on facing page.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dives, wearing ermine-lined hat and mantle with ermine collar, with right hand holding knife, beside woman wearing wrapped headdress, both seated behind draped table with eating vessels and salt cellar, in front of which are female servant, wearing wrapped headdress, holding platter, and male servant, with back turned, raising jug. In foreground, man, with dog at feet, approaches Lazarus, rays as nimbus, holding clapper in right hand and bowl in left hand, with his right foot licked by another dog. Scene in room with tile floor and window. Lazarus: Scene, Death -- Through the window, Lazarus, rays as nimbus, lies on hill, beneath rays descending from cloud. City in background. Miniature for Vespers of Office of the Dead. In lower margin: Fantastic animal, pierced with arrow, confronts archer, wearing hat, with right hand holding club over right shoulder, and bow in left hand. Margins decorated with full borders of foliate and floreate ornament, including thistles; right margin inhabited by bird; lower margin inhabited by fly, behind the archer. Text on facing page.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dives, wearing hat, is seated at draped table below canopy. Loaves, pitcher, knife, and plate of food are on the table. At left, servant, carrying plate with food approaches the table through doorway. Four men are near the table, one possibly indicating with right hand Lazarus, wearing hat, seated on ground next to closed portal of building. He holds clapper with right hand. Of two dogs in foreground, one licks wounds on leg of Lazarus. Beginning of Introit for first Sunday after Pentecost.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Lazarus, wearing hat and ragged clothes, lies on steps of house, holding up bowl to man, wearing cap, in doorway. At right, within house, Dives, wearing fur-trimmed robes, sits at table beneath canopy, with woman, wearing headdress, beside him. Plates of food and salt cellar on table. Two boys, the larger one carrying tray (?), face Dives across table. Two men, wearing hats with plumes, gesturing, stand in front of table, facing away from it, and two men, one wearing hat, the other holding tray, enter from doorway at left side of room. Scene inside house, with arched leaded glass window and niche in wall containing salt cellar. In background at left, in sky, half figure of Abraham, nimbed, wearing gold hat, rays as nimbus around body, holds napkin upon which rests half figure of Lazarus, nude, with joined hands raised. Below, surrounded by flames, Devil, horned, grasps hair of Dives, nude, looking toward Abraham and Lazarus. Face peers around corner of house (hell). Illustration of Luke 16:19-31. Rubric on following page.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Lazarus, wearing hat and ragged clothes, lies on steps of house, holding up bowl to man, wearing cap, in doorway. At right, within house, Dives, wearing fur-trimmed robes, sits at table beneath canopy, with woman, wearing headdress, beside him. Plates of food and salt cellar on table. Two boys, the larger one carrying tray (?), face Dives across table. Two men, wearing hats with plumes, gesturing, stand in front of table, facing away from it, and two men, one wearing hat, the other holding tray, enter from doorway at left side of room. Scene inside house, with arched leaded glass window and niche in wall containing salt cellar. In background at left, in sky, half figure of Abraham, nimbed, wearing gold hat, rays as nimbus around body, holds napkin upon which rests half figure of Lazarus, nude, with joined hands raised. Below, surrounded by flames, Devil, horned, grasps hair of Dives, nude, looking toward Abraham and Lazarus. Face peers around corner of house (hell). Illustration of Luke 16:19-31. Rubric on following page.

Upper half: Christ: Miracle of healing Paralytic -- Christ, cross-nimbed, with right hand raised in blessing and with left hand holding roll, before bed in which reclines paralytic, beneath covers, head on pillow and with both hands raised. To right, another paralytic, carrying pillow on back before Pharisee and men, wearing Jew's hats. Christ: Transfiguration -- Christ, cross-nimbed, with right hand raised in blessing and with left hand holding book, stands surrounded by confounded, nimbed apostles, two with hands raised, the foremost lying on ground. Lower half: Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- At left, Dives, wearing hat, with left hand raised, is seated beside wife, wearing hooded garment, both behind draped table spread with utensils, vessels, and food, and servant standing with arms crossed on breast, holding stick under left arm. To left, Lazarus, wearing hat, leaning on crutches with both hands, stands with sores licked by two of three dogs. Christ: Parable, Wicked Husbandmen -- At right, in vineyard with curling grape vines, two men, raising hoes, the foremost over one of three servants, bleeding, falling or lying on ground.

Upper half: Christ: Miracle of healing Paralytic -- Christ, cross-nimbed, with right hand raised in blessing and with left hand holding roll, before bed in which reclines paralytic, beneath covers, head on pillow and with both hands raised. To right, another paralytic, carrying pillow on back before Pharisee and men, wearing Jew's hats. Christ: Transfiguration -- Christ, cross-nimbed, with right hand raised in blessing and with left hand holding book, stands surrounded by confounded, nimbed apostles, two with hands raised, the foremost lying on ground. Lower half: Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- At left, Dives, wearing hat, with left hand raised, is seated beside wife, wearing hooded garment, both behind draped table spread with utensils, vessels, and food, and servant standing with arms crossed on breast, holding stick under left arm. To left, Lazarus, wearing hat, leaning on crutches with both hands, stands with sores licked by two of three dogs. Christ: Parable, Wicked Husbandmen -- At right, in vineyard with curling grape vines, two men, raising hoes, the foremost over one of three servants, bleeding, falling or lying on ground.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dives, wearing hat, and his wife, wearing headdress, are seated on high backed bench at draped trestle table on which are loaf (?) and two plates with food. Two men, one wearing hood, the other wearing hat stand behind the bench. Another man stands at end of the table. Before the table is bench on which is covered footed vessel with two handles. Dogs sit at each end of the table. In background, in arched doorway, Lazarus, wearing short tunic, with bare legs, stands raising right hand to face, possibly holding object with left hand. Figures wear garments in grisaille. Scene in room decorated with architectural ornament and tile floor, with arched doorway. Miniature enclosed in architectural frame decorated with foliate ornament, two putti grasping cord hanging from top of frame at left, and putto grasping both the cord and left column of frame. Rubric on fol. 71v.

Front: 1) Peter the Apostle, Smiting Rock -- Apostle Peter, holding rod, stands before stream of water, flanked by a bearded male figure and a soldier. Two soldiers, kneeling, drink from the stream. 2) Peter the Apostle, Arrest -- Two soldiers, one almost entirely destroyed, seize Peter by the arms. A bearded male figure stands behind them. 3) Christ, Entry into Jerusalem -- Only foal, palm branch, legs of ass, and part of youth spreading garment remain. 4) Christ: Scene, Unidentified, possibly Christ, Miracle of Healing Blind Born -- Only lower legs and feet of two figures remain. 5) Christ, Miracle of Loaves -- Only feet of Christ, six baskets of bread, and feet of two apostles remain. 6) Christ, Miracle of Raising Lazarus -- Only the feet of Christ and the kneeling figure of Martha (largely broken away) remain. Left end: Hebrews Three, in Fiery Furnace -- Three Hebrews, orant, wearing Persian dress, stand in the flames of a masonry furnace. Right end: Adam and Eve, Fall of Man -- Adam and Eve, nude, covering themselves with leaves, stand flanking a tree without a serpent.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dives, wearing hat, with dog licking sores on his bare legs, stands outside house of Dives. Inside the house, man, wearing hat, standing beside second dog, gestures toward Dives. Behind draped table with plates of food, sit Dives, wearing hat and ermine-lined garment, and his wife, wearing headdress. Margins with foliate and vinescroll ornament in diagonal bands. Margins inhabited by bird and fabulous man, wearing hood with pointed ears, kneeling on one knee and holding vinescroll.

Christ: Parable, Lazarus and Dives -- Dives, wearing hat, with dog licking sores on his bare legs, stands outside house of Dives. Inside the house, man, wearing hat, standing beside second dog, gestures toward Dives. Behind draped table with plates of food, sit Dives, wearing hat and ermine-lined garment, and his wife, wearing headdress. Margins with foliate and vinescroll ornament in diagonal bands. Margins inhabited by bird and fabulous man, wearing hood with pointed ears, kneeling on one knee and holding vinescroll.

Twelve plaques: 1) Three nimbed saints, possibly Apostles. 2) Christ, Meeting Samaritan Woman (John 4:730) -- Two Apostles attending Christ cross-nimbed, seated before Jacobs well, addressing Samaritan woman drawing water from the well. 3) Christ, Miracle of Bethesda Pool -- Paralytic carrying bed on back; Christ cross-nimbed, right hand extended toward the paralytic, left hand holding roll, accompanied by nimbed Apostle, roll in left hand. 4) Christ, Miracle of Raising Lazarus (John 11:4344) -- nimbed Apostle accompanying Christ cross-nimbed, right hand extended toward Lazarus as mummy standing in a tomb portal, man, left hand to face, unwinding grave clothes. 5) Christ, Miracle of Healing Blind Born (John 9:67) -- nimbed Apostle attending Christ cross-nimbed, touching eyes of blind man leaning on staff; to right, blind man washing eyes in pool of Siloam. 6) Christ, Miracle of Healing Demoniac -- Demoniac, half nude, hands bound behind back, addressed by Christ cross-nimbed, right hand raised, roll in left hand, attended by nimbed apostle, roll in left hand. 7) Christ, Appearing to the Apostles -- Christ cross-nimbed, book? in left hand, flanked by two groups of nimbed apostles, some holding books. 8) Apostle Thomas, Incredulity (John 20:2729) -- Thomas the Apostle touching right side of Christ nimbed, right hand raised, left holding book, standing before portal, flanked by two groups of nimbed Apostles, some holding books. 9) Christ, Deposition -- Virgin Mary nimbed, kissing right hand of Christ cross-nimbed, body supported by Joseph of Arimathea standing on bench; to right, John the Evangelist nimbed, book in left hand; Nicodemus standing on bench, taking out nail from left hand with pincers. 10) Virgin Mary, Dormition -- Group of mourning apostles; Christ cross-nimbed, holding up soul of Virgin Mary; angel descending with draped hands; virgin on bed, feet embraced by two Apostles; four daughters of Hebrews. 11) Christ, Entombment -- Nicodemus and Joseph of Arimathea bearing the body of Christ cross-nimbed, toward the portal of the tomb. 12) Three numbed saints in bishops vestments, each holding a book in his left hand.

Choir (Khurus), west wall, zone 2, 1: Abraham, Isaac, Jacob: representing Paradise -- Jacob, Isaac, and Abraham, each with name inscribed on background and on sleeve, nimbed, seated on cushioned throne with footstools, holding soul (that held by Abraham almost entirely destroyed), picking and eating fruit, in right hand; in background, four fruit trees (one destroyed) in which are souls; to right, Personification of soul of Dives, inscribed "Nineve, the unmerciful" (Coptic), nude, hands raised, in flames in furnace inscribed "Amente" (Hell, Coptic) and "The Abyss" (Coptic).
Nave, south wall, zone 2: 5) Christ: Miracle of Healing? (very fragmentary) -- .

Group of six nimbed female saints, in landscape, reading from left to right: Catherine of Alexandria, crowned, holding sword in right hand and open book with pseudo-inscriptions in draped left hand, standing beside dragon with legs emerging from its mouth, beside Martha of Bethany, wearing veil, holding open book with pseudo-inscriptions in left hand, beside Christina of Bolsena (?), before Barbara of Nicomedia, holding open book with pseudo-inscriptions, standing between tower at left, and Margaret of Antioch, with joined hands raised, holding cross, emerging from back of dragon. Margins decorated with border of foliate and floreate ornament, including roses, strawberries and daisies, and inhabited by hybrid animal with two heads, one bird-like, the other human.

Zone 1: 1) Personification of Virtue, Sobriety, labeled SOUBRIETE, crowned, veiled, with both hands holding disk enclosing bird, and treading on recumbent bear, flanked by two trees. Figure against gold filigree background, beneath arcade of two arches, each with head of bearded man in quatrefoil oculus, surmounting two trefoil arches. 2) Hooded Personification of Vice, Gluttony, labeled GLOUTONNIE, as male figure, vomiting into bowl in right hand and with left hand grasping fish in vessel, beside food, utensils and vessels on draped table, flanked by veiled woman grasping his hooded head and by youth with left hand on loaf on the table and right hand raised (Scene, Secular: Banquet). Scene against golf filigree background, beneath arcade of two arches with two animal heads with protruding tongues in quatrefoil oculi in two trefoil arches. Zone 2: 3) Scene, Secular: Banquet -- Personification of Moderation, as male figure, with knife in right hand cutting loaf in left hand, and veiled woman holding goblet in right hand and pitcher in left hand, both behind draped table on which is vessel containing two fishes, one bitten by dog standing on hind legs, beneath architectural frame containing Hand of God in its quatrefoil oculus. 4) Christ: Parable, Lazurus and Dives -- Dives, wearing hat, holding cup in right hand and extending left hand toward veiled woman with right hand raised, flanked by two youths, one playing rebec, and the other blowing recorder, all behind draped table laden with vessels, utensils and food; in foreground, two male servants kneeling, one with knife in right hand, cutting meat on platter, the other raising goblet, and holding pitcher, all beneath architectural frames with two quatrefoil oculi enclosing heads of devils; to right, hooded man holding staff in right hand and extending left hand toward Lazarus, wearing hooded garment, holding object in left hand and vessel in right hand, seated with right foot licked by dog; both beneath architectural frame with oculus enclosing Hand of God blessing. Scenes against gold diapered backgrounds. All compartments within decorated frame.

Zone 1: 1) Personification of Virtue, Sobriety, labeled SOUBRIETE, crowned, veiled, with both hands holding disk enclosing bird, and treading on recumbent bear, flanked by two trees. Figure against gold filigree background, beneath arcade of two arches, each with head of bearded man in quatrefoil oculus, surmounting two trefoil arches. 2) Hooded Personification of Vice, Gluttony, labeled GLOUTONNIE, as male figure, vomiting into bowl in right hand and with left hand grasping fish in vessel, beside food, utensils and vessels on draped table, flanked by veiled woman grasping his hooded head and by youth with left hand on loaf on the table and right hand raised (Scene, Secular: Banquet). Scene against golf filigree background, beneath arcade of two arches with two animal heads with protruding tongues in quatrefoil oculi in two trefoil arches. Zone 2: 3) Scene, Secular: Banquet -- Personification of Moderation, as male figure, with knife in right hand cutting loaf in left hand, and veiled woman holding goblet in right hand and pitcher in left hand, both behind draped table on which is vessel containing two fishes, one bitten by dog standing on hind legs, beneath architectural frame containing Hand of God in its quatrefoil oculus. 4) Christ: Parable, Lazurus and Dives -- Dives, wearing hat, holding cup in right hand and extending left hand toward veiled woman with right hand raised, flanked by two youths, one playing rebec, and the other blowing recorder, all behind draped table laden with vessels, utensils and food; in foreground, two male servants kneeling, one with knife in right hand, cutting meat on platter, the other raising goblet, and holding pitcher, all beneath architectural frames with two quatrefoil oculi enclosing heads of devils; to right, hooded man holding staff in right hand and extending left hand toward Lazarus, wearing hooded garment, holding object in left hand and vessel in right hand, seated with right foot licked by dog; both beneath architectural frame with oculus enclosing Hand of God blessing. Scenes against gold diapered backgrounds. All compartments within decorated frame.

Ambulatory, outer: Panels from bottom to top, medallion 2: 12) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Man, sits on bench next to table on which are coins. With left hand, he indicates Prodigal Son, half nude, seated on other side of the table, tossing three dice with right hand and holding coins with left hand. At left is wine barrel on which are two cups; on ground is another cup. Drapery hangs on rod above. (Squandering inheritance) 13) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Woman, wearing berbette, holding club with right hand, and man, stand in doorway of building each with hand on back of half-nude Son. (Squandering inheritance) 14) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Son, draped in mantle with hood, holding pedum with left hand, extends right hand to man wearing hat, extending his right hand to Son, and indicating with left hand six pigs. (Tending swine) Tree is at left; drapery hangs on rod overhead. 15) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Oak tree in center is flanked by six (?) pigs, and by Son, wearing mantle with hood, seated on ground, resting right arm on pedum, holding head with right hand. Bag (?) on strap is over his right shoulder. Dog sits at right. (Tending swine) 16) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Son, wearing mantle with hood, embraces father wearing hat and fur-lined mantle. At right, woman wearing headdress holds garment. (Returning home) Trees are at left. Around the medallion are four small medallions enclosing kings, crowned, holding floreate scepters. Above medallion: 17) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- At left, Father, wearing hat, raising right hand, looks toward servant, holding axe with both hands at head of calf. (Killing fatted calf) 18) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- In center, Son, flanked by youth and father, wearing hat, is seated at draped table on which are cup, bowl, other vessels. Two servants are behind them at left; at far right woman wearing headdress raises left hand. In background man plays viol. (Feast) 19) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- At right, father, wearing hat, stands facing elder son, holding axe over left shoulder. (Elder son objecting) 20) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Elder son, holding axe over left shoulder, his right right arm grasped by father who grasps right hand of prodigal son.

Bottom to top: Panels: 25) Mary of Egypt: Scene, Burial -- Lion. 26) Mary of Egypt: Scene, Burial -- Zosimus, tonsured (?), holds shoulders of body of Mary wrapped in shroud, arms crossed on her breast. Lion holds her legs; together they bury her. 27) Mary of Egypt: Scene, Burial -- Body of Mary, nimbed, wrapped in shroud, arms crossed on breast is touched by Zosimus, wearing hood, standing beside her. 28-30) Mary of Egypt: Scene, in Paradise -- In center, Abraham, nimbed, is seated on bench, either flanked by or holding, two trees. Soul of Mary, nimbed, is in cloth draped over hands of Abraham. At left and right is angel, each swinging censer with right hand and holding navette in left hand.

Bottom to top: Medallion 4: Panels 13-14) Vincent of Zaragoza: Scene, in Prison -- In lower half of medallion, devil, wing on hindquarters, touches right shoulder of Dacian, crowned, raising right hand, seated with legs crossed on bench. Man holding sword with right hand stands before him. At right, man stands on crenellated wall, before door extending right hand to doorway to prison . Vincent, nimbed, is in the prison, within crenellated walls. Panels 15-16) Vincent of Zaragoza: Scene, Death -- In upper half of medallion, nude Vincent, nimbed and tonsured, arms crossed on abdomen, reclines with head on pillow, on draped bed. Man stands next to bed, arms extended. Cloud edged arc of Heaven is above. At right, Dacian, crowned, holding scepter with right hand, indicates Vincent with left hand. Behind him is man resting right hand on hilt of sword at his waist, and left hand on top of shield. Medallion 5: Panels 17-18) Vincent of Zaragoza: Scene, with the Ravens -- In lower half of medallion, nude Vincent, name inscribed S(ANCTVS) VINCENCIVS, nimbed and tonsured, reclines on ground, partially draped. Bird and raven fly above him. Wolf sits at his feet. At right, man, wearing sheath at waist, holding upturned sword with left hand, stands before Dacian, name inscribed DACIANVS, crowned, raising left hand, is seated on bench. Panels 19-20) Vincent of Zaragoza: Scene, cast into Water -- In upper half of medallion, Dacian, name inscribed DACIANVS, crowned, holding scepter with left hand, extending right hand to right, is seated on cushioned bench. He looks toward boat in which are two men, one holding oar in water, the other dropping into water, body of Vincent, nimbed and tonsured, wrapped in shroud, millstone around his neck.

Ambulatory, outer: Bottom to top: Panels at bottom: 1-2) At left, man wearing hat (?) is seated, holding with both hands, overturned vase from which water flows. At right, man wearing hat, is seated with legs crossed, holding with both hands, overturned vase from which water flows. Possibly Personifications of Rivers of Paradise or water carriers. Medallion 1, panels 3-6): 3) Stephen Protomartyr: Invention of Relics, Relics removed from Sarcophagus -- In bottom quarter of medallion, one of two men, holds lid of sarcophagus and the other holds draped reliquary. At end of the sarcophagus stands John of Jerusalem, nimbed, wearing miter and vestments, extending right hand in blessing over the reliquary and holding crozier with left hand. Another bishop, wearing miter and cope stands behind him. Third man is only partially visible at right and tops of heads are visible in background. Names LUCIANVS and S(ANCTVS) STEPHANVS are inscribed. 4) Stephen Protomartyr: Invention of Relics, Lucian's Vision -- In left quarter of medallion, Stephan, name inscribed S(ANCTVS) STEFANVS, nimbed and tonsured, wearing deacon's vestments, reclines on ground with animals at his feet and birds flying. Above in cloud edged arc of Heaven angel, nimbed, carries nude soul of Stephan, nimbed, with joined hands raised. 5) Stephen Protomartyr: Invention of Relics, Lucian's Vision -- In right quarter of medallion, two of four men place enshrouded body of Stephen, name inscribed S(ANCTVS) STEFANVS, nimbed, into sarcophagus; the other men look on. Above are two angels, nimbed, one holding censer. 6) Stephen Protomartyr: Invention of Relics, Lucian announcing Vision -- In top quarter of medallion, two men, one wearing hat, stand behind Lucian, named inscribed LVCIANVS. He stands before John of Jerusalem, named inscribed S(ANCTVS) IOANNES, nimbed, wearing miter and vestments, raising right hand, holding book with left hand and sitting on cushioned bench. Background and border of window decorated with foliate and geometric ornament.

Ambulatory, outer: Panels from bottom to top: 1-3) Scene, Occupational: Curriery -- At left, two curriers holding skins on round table. In center, small man carrying skins stands behind man, seated on bench, looking toward man (?) wearing hood indicating skin with left hand and holding coin in raised right hand. Woman wearing berbette stands behind him. At right, dog sits behind man stretching skin on frame. Another skin hangs on limb of tree. Medallion 1: 4) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Father, wearing cap, raising right hand, is seated on bench, looking toward son, wearing fillet, possibly holding coin(s). Both wear fur-lined mantles. Drapery hangs from rod over their heads. (Asking for inheritance) 5) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Father, wearing cap and fur lined mantle, raising right hand, extends with left hand, covered cup toward son, wearing fillet, holding coins in fold of garment. They stand flanking chest, lid possibly open. Above them drapery hangs from rod. At left is table on which is cup. (Receiving inheritance) 6) Scene, Occupational: Pastoral -- In center of medallion, older son or servant, holding staff with right hand, beside two cattle. Trees in background. 7) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Son, wearing fillet and fur lined mantle, is astride bridled horse, holding reins with right hand; falcon perches on his raised left hand. Servant, wearing hat, holding walking stick in left hand walks at head of horse. (Departure) 8) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- Son, wearing fillet and fur lined mantle, is astride bridled horse, holding reins with right hand. Woman, wearing berbette, standing next to the horse, extends her arms to son. Sheep and shepherd holding pedum (?) over left shoulder, are at left. (Departure) Around the medallion are four small medallions enclosing kings, crowned, two holding scrolls, one inscribed DE PRODIGO FILIO; the other is illegible. The other two kings hold floreate scepters. Above medallion: 9-11) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- At left, Son and woman embrace; behind her attendant, wearing fillet, raises crown in right hand. Bridled horse is partially visible at left. (At brothel) 10) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- In center, woman, wearing berbette, and son embrace. The are flanked by man, holding bowl on raised left hand and by woman, her right hand holding above head of son. (At brothel) 11) Christ: Parable, Prodigal Son -- At right, woman, standing in doorway of building, looks toward Son, holding staff on right shoulder, walking away. (Dismissed from brothel)

Ambulatory, outer: Panels from bottom to top: 1-3) Scene, Occupational: Curriery -- At left, two curriers holding skins on round table. In center, small man carrying skins stands behind man, seated on bench, looking toward man (?) wearing hood indicating skin with left hand and holding coin in raised right hand. Woman wearing berbette stands behind him. At right, dog sits behind man stretching skin on frame. Another skin hangs on limb of tree. Both wear fur-lined mantles. Drapery hangs from rod over their heads. Holy Women: at Sepulcher -- Personifications of Moon (white) inscribed "the sun hid its light" (Geez) and Sun (red) inscribed "the moon turned to blood" (Geez) above domed Holy Sepulcher surmounted by three crosses and two two-handled vessels; in portal, nimbed angel holding cross-staff, seated on tomb beside square stone removed from entrance, flanked by two nimbed, veiled Holy Women, name of one inscribed "Mary" (Geez), name of the other illegible, each swinging censer, and two helmeted soldiers, one holding spear, the other spear and shield, prostrate. Prefatory miniature.

1) Christ: anointed by Woman -- Beneath partial architectural frame, Christ, cross-nimbed, with hands raised, is flanked by five men, possibly including Judas (cited in text), all gesturing. All are behind draped table set with vessel and loaves. In foreground, Lazarus or Simon the Pharisee extends left hand and points with right hand to Mary Magdalen (cited in text). She pours from ointment jar in left hand and with her hair in right hand dries His feet, beside Martha of Bethany, veiled, extending fish in bowl. 2) Christ: Entry into Jerusalem -- Five apostles, one with hands joined, one with head draped and with hands clasped, all follow Christ, cross-nimbed, with right hand raised. He rides on ass whose reins he holds in left hand, approaching two youths, one undressing, the other holding garment, before city-gate from top of which two youths extend palms. Column miniatures, with decorated backgrounds and frames, follow text. Rubric on fol. 46v.
